Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.

column1: Deception and Forest Essentials are Synonyms
column3: The nozzles on all their bottles are 5 out of 10 times either broken or LEAKY.I have managed to purchase 75% of all of their products — minus the soaps, body oils, hair oils and dusting powders (because who even pays a fortune for your regular organic soap/oil that I can whip up at home! Or better yet, get an excellent alternative elsewhere!)Anyhow, I mailed them to ask for the ingredients list of certain products because they are super secretive about what goes into their “all natural” range of skincare. What did I find?Nothing special.They lie to the customers (foreign customers) and run on deception. For example: NARANGI IS ORANGE!Now, the ingredients list would have English names and then there’s “narangi extract”, narangi peel powder, etc.(???)Why?!Let me tell you what I have figured from testing about 20-30 products of theirs:• flimsy packaging in the name of “reducing plastic”.• clever way of using the kind of spray nozzles that spray so much you’ll be done with the bottle before you start noticing a difference/change.(I have preferred to transfer them into a bottle of rose water from another brand, and that fixed the problem for me because I really like the panchpushp!)• The products aren’t all bad but they’re not anything special. The effect that makes you go wow wears off as your skin adapts to their products (tested this on a few skin types).• their room surround spray nozzles leak heavily. They have completely removed any seals from room sprays!!! They evaporate!!! Why would you risk having something be spilled by children or even adults with loose room spray nozzles!?I had to find a way to hold the lid in place along with the nozzle. Every time I open the nozzle there’s tonnes of evaporated spray + oils spilled onto the inside of the lid and on the spray nozzle.• complete cheapskates. I purchased ALL five of their ubtan range and each of them have just 1-2 at most 3 different ingredients which make them “unique” so you’re forced to purchase the others. The rest of the ingredients are the exact same or repeated!All in the name of profits, sales, and “luxurious Ayurveda”.• Some of their products like the orange and sandalwood moisturizer, quality and formulation are both sub par.• I hope we have all been familiarized with the fair and lovely scent? Their velvet silk cream moisturizer smells the exact same. A total ripoff! And super greasy (my humble apologies to the acne-prone / combination skin bearers).I speak from experience with blending, mixing, pounding and formulating my own skincare for years.I own (in total) over 70 essential + carrier oils and herbal tinctures + powdered products. I know what I’m talking about.It is when you purchase a set of all products from a range (like all 5 ubtan mixes they offer, or all of different rose spray, perfume and room spray etc) is when you realize how you’re being tricked by pretty packaging and some fake reviews (yes I said fake!)The website at least has 90% reviews that are not by real customers. Because who repetitively uses the title “Forest Essentials” over and over in a review, OR, who has the time to write the product name exactly as it is with certain reiterated vocabulary in each and every review?I mean, come on! *scoffs*The ojas balm smells like my mother‘s pain  relief oil that her Ayurvedic doctor blended for her. And it was not half as expensive as the one that’s sold.The only thing that really does knock the charts off is the date and lichee night cream. The only good skincare item.Oh and did I forget to mention? The Rose cardamom body spray, the rose surround spray and the rose perfume do not smell very different from each other?And the toners/hydrosol bottles too, leak when spraying. They don’t just spray a lot, they also leak! I have tried 3-4 of those bottles. It’s not just one defective product, as I too decided that it was, until every other bottle nozzle would do the same! I’m not paying 2k+ for pretty (read: cheap) packaging you know.And the mashobra honey face cleanser is a super mild version of this kashmir saffron cleanser with a couple extra ingredients tossed and taken off the list. Not much difference there.Still want to go ahead and get their products? Sure do, it’s everyone's prerogative to be associated with whoever or whatever. One may pay for the pretty packaging that’s defective I guess.And for the customer support? No. Just no.Someone (I do not wish to take any names) on support team via email, replies to a part of your message and not all of it. Deliberate effort to avoid replying to a part of a message multiple times. (PS:) I tried asking from separate emails (different timelines) just to check if it’s just me or are they really trying to avoid certain questions (and yes they are).It is as though they are trying to avoid giving out information even though, I, as a customer am entitled to that information. What I mean is, the questions weren’t wrong or avoidable either. As a customer you have the right to know what ingredients go in a product whether chemical or not. This should not be too difficult to answer. I have not completely knocked chemicals off my skincare just yet, so it does not make a difference to me to know if it’s completely ‘natural’ or not! I just want to know.They pride themselves on absolutely nothing but deception and ornate packaging. I laugh.I am not surprised that we are being cheated the way that we are because well, who runs on integrity these days, deceit is the new black, deception is the fuel.Also, ONLY IF this particular review is beneficial to you or to your family, then please do share (screenshot, perhaps). Because my review was taken down last time (sorry the product I reviewed was taken down to keep this review from showing, and so my review went down with it)Edited to add: If you purchase here, you’ll receive low-quality stock that smells old/rancid because they think rejects can be sold here and they won’t be questioned about it. You will not find the stuff they sell in their retail outlets here because they can get away with it here.Hope this helps someone!PS: If this review does not appear as verified purchase then please rest assured that I only review products I own. For this product may not have been purchased from amazon but an alternate account, received as a sample, a gift or may have been purchased in store.

column1: Disappointing Product and even more disappointing Customer Support
column3: I am not able to decide whether I am more disappointed in the Forest Essential product or the callous attitude of the customer support team. I had bought Forest Essentials Kashmiri Saffron and Neem Delicate Facial Cleanser, 200mlI from their official website and developed rashes and boils on my face after using the product and used the contact form on the Forest Essential website to bring this to their attention. There was no response to it. In my grievance I had even mentioned that the same thing had happened with me when I had bought another Forest Essential product almost a year ago and contacted customer support team in vain.So in my experience Forest Essential has failed me twice consistently and without any regret or remorse.This was clearly my last purchase from Forest Essentials.

column3: This product is really good in summer..it is soft , very mild but stress relieving fragnance..cleanse well and leaves the skin soft, and smooth and requires just one pump..however it cant combate monsoons and loses its potency...My skin is oily hence it cant help much...hence I am using ponds age miracle face wash which I find is more potent than this one during monsoons...I may use this again during winter and of course it expensive...bought this from the store...
My wife loves this. She has never used a such a gentle face wash and it leaves her skin looking and feeling so very supple. And the fragrance is simply amazing!
It is an excellent cleanser for oily skin type. My skin texture has improved immensely. It has a very calming and soothing fragrance too. It gently cleanses the skin and is very mild.
nice, loved it, smooth skin after applying, genuine product makes ur skin good. Strongly recommended go for it

I almost never repeat face washes unless and until it really impresses me. I  started with pond’s and pears face wash ( I used to buy them with my pocket money since the concept of face washes was new and my Mumma thought it as another one of my crazy expenses.)PROS:The fact that it is chemical free!!!!The amazing refreshing smell.Gives an instant glow to my face.I have noticed a teeny reduction of my gigantic pores after I have started using it but I am also using Fabindia rose water so i guess it is a joined effort of both the products.It is suitable for all skin types..even sensitive skin.A very small quantity is required for one wash hence it will last me a loong time.Does not dry my skin. Although I have combination skin I do not like face washes that strip my face of all the moisture.CONSI cannot think of anything except the price.But I am willing to spend this much on a fab product like this.And since it is too mild i mean if you have travelled and have all that grime and dust on your face..i feel using this face wash only wont give you a squeaky clean feel because it lathers very less. I therefore don’t use it after I come home in the evening after office.

column1: Average Results / Strong Rose scent / Review after using entire bottle
column3: I got this delivered in March 2nd week and the bottle has almost come to end; I use it mostly once or max twice a day to wash my face - so lasted about 3-3.5 month for one person. You need very small quantity of it to wash.The face wash has strong rose scent - initially -  it is overpowering but you get used to it. No other notes are discernible except for rose.There is no visible change to face as such but it is not a drying face wash , i have combination skin and I did not notice any drying ; on contrary I feel it does not clear out oil on nose very well and I had use to charcoal nose -strip every week to remove white heads.Overall - my verdict is that it is a mild face wash with a slightly over powering rose scent ; the Neem & saffron face wash of same brand has better fragrance ( I have used that one as well) .  Also - it is not 100% chemical free just that it is a glycerin/honey based face wash. but this also contains Tochopheryl Acetate.Buy it - if you have money and extra sensitive skin ; otherwise do not expect any dramatic results for your skin.If my review has helped you - pls press helpful.
Rate is so high. Neither impressed nor disappointed. Okayish experience with forest essential
Super
Loved its fragrance. Though pricey, it lasted for a long time.

The face cleanser is beautifully rose scented. Just a little bit is enough to wash the face well. My skin felt alive and supple after use. After sampling this will certainly purchase the bigger quantity.
Excellent face wash

column1: I have to pay for this product Rs 425 but the MRP is  Rs 350

column3: I do not like the new packaging. It has a bigger opening due to which a large amount of liquid comes out. I think there is some problem with the cap too. There is a plastic cover stuck inside the cap which does not come out. This problem was not there in the previous packaging.

column1: Haven’t had Acne/Pimples since 6months! Wonder Wash!
column3: I was introduced to Forest Essentials facewash by a friend in Jan’20 and since then I have stuck to this brand of facewash only. I haven’t had a breakout of acne/pimples since Jan’20 which otherwise I had every month! Very refreshing and light on the skin, I use it daily, and a small amount works wonders! I keep switching between this one and saffron neem one from the same brand. A small bottle lasts me months, may be because I mostly use it once a day only. Have tried all herbal and non herbal brands(Indian and Foreign) but nothing has helped me to keep a tight check on pimples/clear skin as Forest Essentials Face Cleanser! Go for it. Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.

I am 34+ years old. It worked well on my skin making it healthy and has got the young look, removed all the hard layer of my skin. Overall product is good, except it is comedogenic. I got black heads and blackness all over my nose. Check on it.
It's very nice facial cleanser, suited to my skin. You can also try it once.

I have a very sensitive skin. I do get a lot of breakouts and have also been reluctant in using any face wash or face cream. I came across this product which was a gift. I loved the smell and used it for a while. And here I am now for the third time. It's really good and just a tiny drop is enough for whole face. It worked for me. As long as side effects is concerned..been using it for a year but never had any. It's a good buy :)

I've been using this for a few months now. I swear by this face wash. It's very gentle on your skin, has the right amount of lather and smells heavenly! You only need one pump to get enough product per use and it lasts for a very long time. It may not be effective in removing heavy make up, which works fine for me.Given the fact that it lasts for a long time, the high price is ok.

This is a great product. I m very particualr in chosing all natural ingredient products and this has kept up all my expectations. It removes all the oil and dirt from skin. I like the neem kesar face wash more since it suits my skin more.

This facial cleanser needs recognition!After buying this TWICE for my teenage sibling, my partner and myself at their outlets, I finally ordered this online. Not only was it delivered on the same day (I placed the order before 8am), the packaging is exactly as seen in stores and I didn't have to leave the house!This cleanser is phenomenal. My skin is extremely sensitive and scar prone. I use this as many as 6 times a day and my skin retains it's moisture and surprisingly hasn't broken out. Lasts for about 2 months, so for the price, it's a win!

column1: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all
column3: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all. I have been using it for more than a month now. Has a very pleasant smell and leaves the skin magically supple. All that dreamy stuff is true. But the basic purpose of a cleaner is to clean. No matter how much quantity you use and how much you try to massage your face with it, the dirt and grime doesn't come off. You will feel nice and delicate and then you go back and check with a little toner on a cotton ball, there will still be dirt on it. Boy, you could only use a cloth instead and you will still see dirt left over on your 'supple nice smelling' face. It's useless. Maybe an apt product for a posh homemaker who never leaves the four walls but not for the regular person. For what it costs, I'd get much better products in other brands which provide these additional 'features' in addition to performing its basic function - cleaning!

column1: Golden products in need of user friendly packaging

column1: If you have normal/combination skin type, then you'll end up having pimples.
column3: I loved the plump feel I get after applying the cream + refreshing scent. However, (this is my honest review) after applying every morning for a week I got 3 pimples due to oilness it creates after 4/5hrs of application. Was extremely happy with the improvement of my skin texture but highly disappointed after seeing pimples on face which I had avoided for 6 months. So if you have oily/normal/combination skin - you might end up inviting unwanted pimples.

Yes, it did moisturize and hydrate the skin pretty well. But it did not do anything for hyperpigmentation or dark spot as it claim at the back. And neither it showed any good results on fine lines. So, why 5 stars, because it was a nice moisturizer for a sensitive, oily, and acne prone skin that I have, and it is not overpriced. It did not cause any unnecessary breakouts, and this is what I was looking for in a moisturizer. Plus, it's a good amount of product for the paid price. For a regular moisturizing purpose I will buy this again.

column1: BEWARE of this brand and their sunscreen
column3: I'm not sure how are companies like this even allowed to legally exist since their products are straight up lying to customers about what's in them.First, lets talk about the whole "natural" brand. They call themselves Ayurvedic and Organically Pure when in reality if you look at their ingredients list, they don't even reveal majority of their ingredients. Their ingredients list only reveal less than 20% of the ingredients that it contains, the remaining 80% are unknown. It's simple, if you have nothing to hide then you simply wouldn't hide it.Secondly, if you don't believe the above conjecture then lets talk about their Sunscreen and the scientific testing done on them. The Department of Consumer Affairs of India tested 12 different sunscreens and published a 9 page long study about their findings. In their study they found and I quote "Biotique contains a negligible amount of SPF (2.01) against the claimed 30 – hence, it is not recommended."So, they claim they have 30 SPF but the testing done on their product revealed that it barely had 2.01SPF in reality. How can anyone trust a brand who blatantly lies about such an important factor in their sunscreen?(Note • You can google "the department of consumer affairs india sunscreen " and read the above mentioned study yourself too.)Due to these reasons above, I've rated their products 1 star.

column1: Biotique Ocean Kelp - Unique Blue Shampoo !!
column3: Biotique - Ocean Kelp Anti Hair Fall costed me ₹ 218, quantity was 340 ml.Good price to quantity ratio.This is unique shampoo, content is new - Ocean Kelp which is algae found in oceans.Shampoo color is bluish & is thin gel form. Looks good too.Ingredients are unique/new - Soapberry, Bhringraj (False daisy), Ocean Kelp, Neem (Azadirachta indica), Flame of the Forest (Butea monosperma).100% Ayurvedic shampoo, but it also creates sufficient foam if not much like full synthetic soaps.These unique ingredients will surely creates some impact on hairs, positively.My hairs feels refreshed & cleaned after using this shampoo.Overall, I like it & will recommend this shampoo to everyone 🧴.

The brand claims to be all natural, giving an impression that the product does not contain toxic chemicals. In reality, the brand has consciously chosen to mention only a select number of ingredients (which are natural) and hidden away the rest of ingredients (which i am assuming are harsh chemicals). If you are really all natural, then why not mention all ingredients? This is a classic example of using smart marketing tactics to sell off poor quality products. Consumers are the ones at a loss here. Do not fall for such brands.

I have been using the Biotique Bio Apricot Refreshing Body Wash for a couple of weeks now, and I must say, I am impressed. The first thing that struck me was the delightful apricot fragrance. It is refreshing and invigorating, leaving me feeling energized after every shower.The body wash lathers up nicely and leaves my skin feeling soft and smooth. It does not strip away the natural oils from my skin and provides long-lasting hydration, keeping it moisturized all day long.One of the things that I appreciate about this body wash is that it is free from harmful chemicals such as parabens and sulfates. It is 100% natural, making it safe and gentle on my skin.Overall, I would highly recommend the Biotique Bio Apricot Refreshing Body Wash to anyone looking for a natural and refreshing body wash that provides hydration and leaves the skin feeling soft and supple. It is definitely a must-try!

Biotique product - which means high standards and with the some of the pleasantest of fragrances.Content includes wild turmeric/haldi and so this is the only one I opt for when there're any skin issues like at present it's that Feb winter to summer transition climate when all that soaps & certain other body washes do is to make skin more dry & itchy - Biotique apricot bodywash is very soft on the skin, probably as it has haldi/turmeric and also as it claims to have zero soap content i.e. natural soapnuts (isn't it called shikakai?!) in it does the 'cleaning job'. Have been using it for many years now & is one of the favorite body washes.Tip to make the bottle last longer is to use a loofah to bubble up a squeeze of the body wash mixed with little water & use for whole body. Direct application, without loofah, though not harmful (do use it straight, when skin if so dry that even loofah hurts), might end up affecting our 'pockets' badly :-)Pros: A few months ago, 210ml used to cost 180rs, now 190ml costs as much - well, inflation probably! Some sellers at Amazon gives a little off the MRP though.Secondly I think Biotique goes for bio technology to replicate nature-similar substances and from an Ayurvedic perspective it may not be as all-natural as say some of the local cottage industry products. The quality of Biotique products are way higher than most cottage industry products & so are the fragrances they employ - very subtle, soft & pleasant - which should offset any drawbacks there, if at all, from a layman point of view.

I purchased 2 bottles with a lot of hope after reading so many positive review here. Liked it in the first 2 uses but soon itching started on the skin. It claims to be soap free but ironically soap free does not mean sulphates free. It definitely has sulphates. My skin is highly sensitive to sulphates and I had the same itching, redness and dryness as I get from a harsh sulphates based product. To add to that, thinking of it to be mild, I even used it on my head instead of shampoo and within 2-3 uses got such severe itching that took 2 months to heal. Was using for my kid but have now stopped using it. If you have sensitive dry skin, don't buy it. Eventually it would make the skin scratchy and itchy. Most of the people reviewing it here are those who are used to using normal commercial products and hence for them it is something good and nice. Use your own judgement.

column1: Very mild; does not cause itching
column3: Forest essential shampoos rated in order of cleansing strength:Bhringaraj & Shikakai (mild) < Jalapatti & Brahmi < Amla, Honey & Mulethi (harsh)If you use more viscous hair oils buy either Amla or Jalapatti shampoo.If you use light hair oils buy Bhringaraj or Jalapatti shampoo.I was utterly confused between all the variants even after reading multiple reviews so ended up purchasing 50ml of all three together. Now I use these on rotational basis.Tested all of them coupled with Kama ayurveda Bhringraj oil and all three of them were able to get rid of oil in 2 washes ( even the mildest variant). Though Amla ended up drying my hairs.Hairfall: Normal hairfall...did not notice shampoo induced hairfall. If you have shampoo induced hairfall this brand may come to rescue but like any other shampoo it wont do miracles. My scalp itches severely with any chemical laden shampoo...luckily all three variants did not cause this issue.Is it overpriced? Yes, it is. For that matter all forest essentials products are.Still confused? Maybe buy all three in 50ml...either you will love them or save yourself from committing to a bigger bottle.As for me...I find them above average and as long as they dont itch my scalp will continue investing.

The product used to be a lot thicker but recently purchased one is literally a watered down version. For the amount they are charging, its a shame that they can’t maintain the quality. How is it any better than other fmcg company products that cost 1/5th the amount ?

column1: the hair falling and thinning has decreased tremendously & my hair is so much better, of course like any ayurverdic product it needs ...
column3: I had major hair fall and thinning problems due to change of place and weather + stress , i started using this shampoo as suggested by a friend & have been using it for the last 6 months now and i can see the quality of my hair has improved alot . the bhringraj does magic to my hair  . the hair falling and thinning has decreased tremendously & my hair is so much better, of course like any ayurverdic product it needs time to show.Also i oil my hair with Kama Ayurveda Bringadi Intensive Hair Treatment which works as a conditioner , this combination has worked well for me & my hair problems.

I have had a hairfall problem for 2-3 years now especially during the rainy season. But then I went on to buy this product and have been using it for 1.5 months and it has given me superb results. I dont find any hair on my pillow, combs and even towels. There is a visible change in hair thickness as well. The only downside is that it hasn't done too much for dandruff and has made the scalp a little dry. I would suggest this to anyone who has a hairfall problem. Top product.

Fragrance is good and smells natural, but I found it’s too expensive (almost 3 times) for natural herbal product compare to other herbal products in market and result we get is same as other natural & herbal product. I didn’t find value for money for this product.

column1: IS your hair falling and you don't know why?
column3: I'm not writing this review after one experience or just off hand.  I actually have done some experimenting to see if it's this shampoo that was causing my hair to fall.  I loved all their products. But then a friend told me she had a lot of people she knew who were getting rashes or their hair was falling.  My HAIR has never fallen in all my life.  My hair is very thick. When I comb my hair, only ONE hair will fall out.  Suddenly, last year my hair started falling in big bunches.  I never thought it was this product.  After all it was Forrest Essentials!  But then i tried a few times, going to a diff shampoo. And i saw my hair fall stopped.  This last week , again, i tried this shampoo after many months and suddenly my hair is falling again.  Need i say more?

Have used a lot of shampoos and a lot of really great ones, but still this one has really stood out. Firstly, the ingredient list is so natural. Secondly it not harsh on hair but cleanses really well. I have hair that can dry out easily if the shampoo is not nourishing, this one does not dry out my hair but leaves it soft, full of volume and with no frizz. Above all, my hair grew really fast while using the this shampoo.

Have used a lot of shampoos and a lot of really great ones, but still this one has really stood out. Firstly, the ingredient list is so natural. Secondly it not harsh on hair but cleanses really well. I have hair that can dry out easily if the shampoo is not nourishing, this one does not dry out my hair but leaves it soft, full of volume and with no frizz. Above all, my hair grew really fast while using the this shampoo.

column1: IS your hair falling and you don't know why?
column3: I'm not writing this review after one experience or just off hand.  I actually have done some experimenting to see if it's this shampoo that was causing my hair to fall.  I loved all their products. But then a friend told me she had a lot of people she knew who were getting rashes or their hair was falling.  My HAIR has never fallen in all my life.  My hair is very thick. When I comb my hair, only ONE hair will fall out.  Suddenly, last year my hair started falling in big bunches.  I never thought it was this product.  After all it was Forrest Essentials!  But then i tried a few times, going to a diff shampoo. And i saw my hair fall stopped. column1: Stopped the boils on my scalp.
column3: As i live in a humid climate due to sweat etc i would get scalp boils. Commercial shampoos with sls would make the situation worse.So now i wash my hair twice a week. I make sure to oil it. I use a mix of herbal Hair oil with the body shop tea tree oil few drops added to it. Then i let it sit for two hours. Then double cleanse (wash it twice) with the forest essentials shampoo and conditioner.Sometimes i finish the cleanse with an apple cider vinegar wash. This combo has made sure my scalp is not dry and itchy at the same time the boils have also gone.

My wife has ordered this shampoo, so I thought to use it. I have hereditary problem of hair loss. So I can only use ayurvedic. And trust me I don't feel any hairloss or dandruff in past 2-3 months .Plus Point - Scent is amazing.

column1: Harshest of the three variants; works well with oil
column3: Forest essential shampoos rated in order of cleansing strength:Bhringaraj & Shikakai (mild) < Jalapatti & Brahmi < Amla, Honey & Mulethi (harsh)If you use more viscous hair oils buy either Amla or Jalapatti shampoo.If you use light hair oils buy Bhringaraj or Jalapatti shampoo.I was utterly confused between all the variants even after reading multiple reviews so ended up purchasing 50ml of all three together. Now I use these on rotational basis.Tested all of them coupled with Kama ayurveda Bhringraj oil and all three of them were able to get rid of oil in 2 washes ( even the mildest variant). Obviously the quantity of shampoo used varies. Amla cleans hair with minimal amount but ends up drying hairs a bit.Hairfall: Normal hairfall...did not notice shampoo induced hairfall. If you have shampoo induced hairfall this brand may come to rescue but like any other shampoo it wont do miracles. My scalp itches severely with any chemical laden shampoo...luckily all three variants did not cause this issue.Is it overpriced? Yes, it is. For that matter all forest essentials products are.Still confused? Maybe buy all three in 50ml...either you will love them or save yourself from committing to a bigger bottle.As for me...I find them above average and as long as they don't itch my scalp will continue investing.Amla variant: You will have to pair this with oil and hair mask/conditioner/ serum. Don't do that mistake of using it without oil application otherwise it will dry your hair immensely. Personally this is my least preferred shampoo out of three variants.
I have been using FE products for a few years and they are absolutely worth it… They are fragrant and Less chemically harmful products and do their designated job…. Can’t go wrong with this one

column1: Can be easily used for any skin type.
column3: So I have been using this face wash since  2 years or so. The fragrance is quiet decent & it leaves the skin shining and refreshing. Quantity to be used is barely 1 drop. It is quite apt for any and all skin types.
Not worth at this price.Feels good after wash .But some time later skin feels dry.Not at all feels like an ayurvedic product.

column1: A bit pricey, but little goes long way...
column3: I bought the small bottle. Its fragrance is mild, but heavenly.. Just like every forest essentials product, smell takes over.It is sensitive on skin, the name says it all.. gently cleanses, no breakouts from using it. but only drawback is even with saffron and honey, it doesn't improve the skin tone. Definitely not a whitening face wash. It surely does brightens up the face for an hour or two. That's enough for a face wash, I guess..
awesome
Nice

column1: Haven’t had acne/pimples since 6months now! Wonder Wash!
column3: I was introduced to Forest Essentials facewash by a friend in Jan’20 and since then I have stuck to this brand of facewash only. I haven’t had a breakout of acne/pimples since Jan’20 which otherwise I had every month! Very refreshing and light on the skin, I use it daily, and a small amount works wonders! I keep switching between this one and rose honey lemon one from the same brand. A small bottle lasts me months, may be because I mostly use it once a day only. Have tried all herbal and non herbal brands(Indian and Foreign) but nothing has helped me to keep a tight check on pimples/clear skin as Forest Essentials Face Cleanser! Go for it. Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.
Its good, but not good as Honey Mashorba facial cleanser.
Very nice product...smells like heaven
Suit my skin

But it worked me alot...its been 2 month im using it..u need a less quantity of product..so it long last..mine is combination skin..and I'm using in my morning routine 😻
Good product

column1: Perfect for oily and combination skin!
column3: I just love everything about this facewash!  I'm first time using skincare products.. And  tried  the plum green tea facewash too.. But oh my god! This facewash is just perfect for me! I have oily skin.. It's super light on face, cleans my face gently... Fragrance is also not so strong..  Controls oil on my face! Today is the first time I've used it and wow!  It's amazing! 😍  will put a review after 1month of using it! And also I love the tiny little bottle it's so cute!
Not harsh on skin. Good for daily use
Awesome facewash

I have acne prone but ageing skin so this facewash is gentle and mild and does not dry out my skin. The smell is subtle but very pleasant. A bottle lasts me a year, cause you really need a just a dot to clean your face, so it's not as expensive as it seems.

column1: Diluted with Water - destroyed a good product
column3: When I first bought this product, I was in love with it due to its fragrance and quality. However, Forest Essential has diluted this product so much with water, its no longer a face wash but some water solution. you can use the small bottle only 3-4 times at best. Earlier product was so much better but companies like Forest Essential think customers will not notice the difference between face wash and water.

column1: Thankyou Forest essentials for such an amazing product .
column3: I must say this ia an awesome product.Due to winters my skin became so dry though i am having a combination skin but this this face wash became a magic to my skin.Its so mild , the fragrance is very mild just like pure saffron.And even even everyone is saying that my skin has beautiful glow..Thankyou Forest essentials for such an amazing product & THANKYOU to Amazon for the serving us..

column1: Way to expansive product. but got positive result on my skin.
column3: Way to expansive for being a facewash. Go for it if you have some skin issue ,it will give you a great result. but is have normal skin without any issue then go for neem face wash. There are plenty of those in the market with good quality and price.

I am happy to buy and will purchase second bottle soon.If you want to buy go for it.It's is small bottle but if you will used to it.Will go for it.It's luxurious but too much costly.Not package friendly.

👍👍👍It has a very nice result. But it is a natural product. If some people are allergic don't buy.BUT it is an awesome product. I am in love with it fragrance and it is a nice face wash your face feels very fresh and it glows

This is a good facewash... But one thing that I personally don't like about it, is the overwhelming smell of this facewash... Otherwise this facewash adds a subtle glow after use and also because neem is present in it... I had very less acne after I started using it

Good product, feels great on your skin and scent is amazing.This lasts around 1-2 weeks depending on your use. I would suggest buy this to check if this product suits you and if yes, then buy the bigger version of this product.

column1: Expensive, fragrant, good for dry skin, might have to use more than once for oily.
column3: Firstly, the cleanser comes in a plastic bottle and not glass. Second, the fragrance is amazing! It feels heavenly and luxurious. Third, it doesn't strip your skin of oils, it's mild but other than the fragrance the actual 'cleansing' experience isn't that great. Feels like rinsing oily skin with water, then a rubbery feel. You might have to use it twice if your skin is oily. After patting your skin dry, it feels good, the fragrance specially stays on for so long.❤️ The price for such quantity is quite high.

I liked it. It make my skin very soft and clean. After washing, I don't feel the dry tightness on my face, skin is still  moist. Only thing I don't like is the scent, but this is personal,  only because it is not my type.
It is best product have come across.However it is bit expensive but totally worth it.One must definately try this face wash and feel the difference on the face .Totally refreshing amd rejunevating.👍

column1: Best facial cleanser for Sensitive skin!!
column3: I’ve a very sensitive skin. Get acnes most of the time. Can’t say it cure acnes or prevents them completely but IT SURE MAKES YOUR SKIN FEELS GOOD. So light!! And the smell. Uff!! Been using this since the last 3 years.

column1: Must try for all skin types
column3: I am using this for a long time it’s good after wash you can feel your skin becomes soft and more clear and soft than before.. scent is mild.. it’s costly but results are good than the price is worth it..

Since I started using this cleanser, haven’t moved to any other product. My skin is highly sensitive and get blemishes and breakout with mildest of products so this has come as such a relief.While it might seem pricey, it lasts surprisingly long. Mine lasts for 4-5 months. Definitely a must try .

I luv this face wash very much. Have tried many face washes but never felt satisfied. The smell is slightly string and astringent like. Except for the smell i luv this product so so much. It makes my skin look and feel softer. No added soap in this product, i could feel the absence of soap but it cleaned the skin so very well. MUST BUY FOR PPL IN SEARCH OF A GOOD FACE WASH. Thank you first essentials for such a great product. 😍

Wet your face with warm water, and take 2 pumps and use circular motion to cleanse. Don't expect a lot of lather, it's a good thing it doesn't lather much, but it cleanses really well.I sure wish Forest Essentials products had better packaging. The bottle itself is alright, but the top keeps coming off. NOT FOR TRAVELLING! :-/ WE NEED BETTER DESIGNED BOTTLES. LOVE THE PRODUCTS!

This face cleanser is a glorified face wash and not a makeup remover.But I still love it.You're supposed to use it on a damp face.Be careful and take only a teeny tiny bit.It won't lather.And the effect(skin so soft that I can't resist touching it again and again) will be noticeable only after using it consistently for 3-4 days.Stop using it for a couple of days and then it is bye bye soft skin.It doesn't do a single blessed thing about blemishes.But then I had zero expectations about that.I haven't noticed any glow either.The fragrance is heavenly! It is so subtle and is a blessing to people who can't stand strong perfumes.And the pump is so convenient.

I absolutely love this product. I have stopped using any other face wash or cleanser. This is perfect for all skin types as my skin is sensitive and i have never liked any product for my face so much.

I have an extreme combination skin, my face is super dry and my T-zone is EXTREMELY oily. NO combination product has ever worked perfectly for my skin besides THIS face wash.I've started using this only on my T-zone and all the breakouts have subsided. The white heads on my nose are nearly gone and with a bi-weekly use of their- the hand pound fruit scrub- my skin is GLOWING!

column1: gentle magic -- pretty good mild cleanser

But just maybe, I wonder if another Ayurvedic cleanser (That smells amazing and not like neem), if diluted, would achieve the same!? It's really mild folks ;)

column1: Deception and Forest Essentials are Synonyms
column3: The nozzles on all their bottles are 5 out of 10 times either broken or LEAKY.I have managed to purchase 75% of all of their products — minus the soaps, body oils, hair oils and dusting powders (because who even pays a fortune for your regular organic soap/oil that I can whip up at home! Or better yet, get an excellent alternative elsewhere!)Anyhow, I mailed them to ask for the ingredients list of certain products because they are super secretive about what goes into their “all natural” range of skincare. What did I find?Nothing special.They lie to the customers (foreign customers) and run on deception. For example: NARANGI IS ORANGE!Now, the ingredients list would have English names and then there’s “narangi extract”, narangi peel powder, etc.(???)Why?!Let me tell you what I have figured from testing about 20-30 products of theirs:• flimsy packaging in the name of “reducing plastic”.• clever way of using the kind of spray nozzles that spray so much you’ll be done with the bottle before you start noticing a difference/change.(I have preferred to transfer them into a bottle of rose water from another brand, and that fixed the problem for me because I really like the panchpushp!)• The products aren’t all bad but they’re not anything special. The effect that makes you go wow wears off as your skin adapts to their products (tested this on a few skin types).• their room surround spray nozzles leak heavily. They have completely removed any seals from room sprays!!! They evaporate!!! Why would you risk having something be spilled by children or even adults with loose room spray nozzles!?I had to find a way to hold the lid in place along with the nozzle. Every time I open the nozzle there’s tonnes of evaporated spray + oils spilled onto the inside of the lid and on the spray nozzle.• complete cheapskates. I purchased ALL five of their ubtan range and each of them have just 1-2 at most 3 different ingredients which make them “unique” so you’re forced to purchase the others. The rest of the ingredients are the exact same or repeated!All in the name of profits, sales, and “luxurious Ayurveda”.• Some of their products like the orange and sandalwood moisturizer, quality and formulation are both sub par.• I hope we have all been familiarized with the fair and lovely scent? Their velvet silk cream moisturizer smells the exact same. A total ripoff! And super greasy (my humble apologies to the acne-prone / combination skin bearers).I speak from experience with blending, mixing, pounding and formulating my own skincare for years.I own (in total) over 70 essential + carrier oils and herbal tinctures + powdered products. I know what I’m talking about.It is when you purchase a set of all products from a range (like all 5 ubtan mixes they offer, or all of different rose spray, perfume and room spray etc) is when you realize how you’re being tricked by pretty packaging and some fake reviews (yes I said fake!)The website at least has 90% reviews that are not by real customers. Because who repetitively uses the title “Forest Essentials” over and over in a review, OR, who has the time to write the product name exactly as it is with certain reiterated vocabulary in each and every review?I mean, come on! *scoffs*The ojas balm smells like my mother‘s pain  relief oil that her Ayurvedic doctor blended for her. And it was not half as expensive as the one that’s sold.The only thing that really does knock the charts off is the date and lichee night cream. The only good skincare item.Oh and did I forget to mention? The Rose cardamom body spray, the rose surround spray and the rose perfume do not smell very different from each other?And the toners/hydrosol bottles too, leak when spraying. They don’t just spray a lot, they also leak! I have tried 3-4 of those bottles. It’s not just one defective product, as I too decided that it was, until every other bottle nozzle would do the same! I’m not paying 2k+ for pretty (read: cheap) packaging you know.And the mashobra honey face cleanser is a super mild version of this kashmir saffron cleanser with a couple extra ingredients tossed and taken off the list. Not much difference there.Still want to go ahead and get their products? Sure do, it’s everyone's prerogative to be associated with whoever or whatever. One may pay for the pretty packaging that’s defective I guess.And for the customer support? No. Just no.Someone (I do not wish to take any names) on support team via email, replies to a part of your message and not all of it. Deliberate effort to avoid replying to a part of a message multiple times. (PS:) I tried asking from separate emails (different timelines) just to check if it’s just me or are they really trying to avoid certain questions (and yes they are).It is as though they are trying to avoid giving out information even though, I, as a customer am entitled to that information. What I mean is, the questions weren’t wrong or avoidable either. As a customer you have the right to know what ingredients go in a product whether chemical or not. This should not be too difficult to answer. I have not completely knocked chemicals off my skincare just yet, so it does not make a difference to me to know if it’s completely ‘natural’ or not! I just want to know.They pride themselves on absolutely nothing but deception and ornate packaging. I laugh.I am not surprised that we are being cheated the way that we are because well, who runs on integrity these days, deceit is the new black, deception is the fuel.Also, ONLY IF this particular review is beneficial to you or to your family, then please do share (screenshot, perhaps). Because my review was taken down last time (sorry the product I reviewed was taken down to keep this review from showing, and so my review went down with it)Edited to add: If you purchase here, you’ll receive low-quality stock that smells old/rancid because they think rejects can be sold here and they won’t be questioned about it. You will not find the stuff they sell in their retail outlets here because they can get away with it here.Hope this helps someone!PS: If this review does not appear as verified purchase then please rest assured that I only review products I own. For this product may not have been purchased from amazon but an alternate account, received as a sample, a gift or may have been purchased in store.

column1: Disappointing Product and even more disappointing Customer Support
column3: I am not able to decide whether I am more disappointed in the Forest Essential product or the callous attitude of the customer support team. I had bought Forest Essentials Kashmiri Saffron and Neem Delicate Facial Cleanser, 200mlI from their official website and developed rashes and boils on my face after using the product and used the contact form on the Forest Essential website to bring this to their attention. There was no response to it. In my grievance I had even mentioned that the same thing had happened with me when I had bought another Forest Essential product almost a year ago and contacted customer support team in vain.So in my experience Forest Essential has failed me twice consistently and without any regret or remorse.This was clearly my last purchase from Forest Essentials.

column1: The saffron scent is very nice. Please remember

Although I have combination skin I do not like face washes that strip my face of all the moisture.CONSI cannot think of anything except the price.But I am willing to spend this much on a fab product like this.And since it is too mild i mean if you have travelled and have all that grime and dust on your face..i feel using this face wash only wont give you a squeaky clean feel because it lathers very less. I therefore don’t use it after I come home in the evening after office.

Have tried all herbal and non herbal brands(Indian and Foreign) but nothing has helped me to keep a tight check on pimples/clear skin as Forest Essentials Face Cleanser! Go for it. Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.

column1: Deception and Forest Essentials are Synonyms
column3: The nozzles on all their bottles are 5 out of 10 times either broken or LEAKY.I have managed to purchase 75% of all of their products — minus the soaps, body oils, hair oils and dusting powders (because who even pays a fortune for your regular organic soap/oil that I can whip up at home! Or better yet, get an excellent alternative elsewhere!)Anyhow, I mailed them to ask for the ingredients list of certain products because they are super secretive about what goes into their “all natural” range of skincare. What did I find?Nothing special.They lie to the customers (foreign customers) and run on deception. For example: NARANGI IS ORANGE!Now, the ingredients list would have English names and then there’s “narangi extract”, narangi peel powder, etc.(???)Why?!Let me tell you what I have figured from testing about 20-30 products of theirs:• flimsy packaging in the name of “reducing plastic”.• clever way of using the kind of spray nozzles that spray so much you’ll be done with the bottle before you start noticing a difference/change.(I have preferred to transfer them into a bottle of rose water from another brand, and that fixed the problem for me because I really like the panchpushp!)• The products aren’t all bad but they’re not anything special. The effect that makes you go wow wears off as your skin adapts to their products (tested this on a few skin types).• their room surround spray nozzles leak heavily. They have completely removed any seals from room sprays!!! They evaporate!!! Why would you risk having something be spilled by children or even adults with loose room spray nozzles!?I had to find a way to hold the lid in place along with the nozzle. Every time I open the nozzle there’s tonnes of evaporated spray + oils spilled onto the inside of the lid and on the spray nozzle.• complete cheapskates. I purchased ALL five of their ubtan range and each of them have just 1-2 at most 3 different ingredients which make them “unique” so you’re forced to purchase the others. The rest of the ingredients are the exact same or repeated!All in the name of profits, sales, and “luxurious Ayurveda”.• Some of their products like the orange and sandalwood moisturizer, quality and formulation are both sub par.• I hope we have all been familiarized with the fair and lovely scent? Their velvet silk cream moisturizer smells the exact same. A total ripoff! And super greasy (my humble apologies to the acne-prone / combination skin bearers).I speak from experience with blending, mixing, pounding and formulating my own skincare for years.I own (in total) over 70 essential + carrier oils and herbal tinctures + powdered products. I know what I’m talking about.It is when you purchase a set of all products from a range (like all 5 ubtan mixes they offer, or all of different rose spray, perfume and room spray etc) is when you realize how you’re being tricked by pretty packaging and some fake reviews (yes I said fake!)The website at least has 90% reviews that are not by real customers. Because who repetitively uses the title “Forest Essentials” over and over in a review, OR, who has the time to write the product name exactly as it is with certain reiterated vocabulary in each and every review?I mean, come on! *scoffs*The ojas balm smells like my mother‘s pain  relief oil that her Ayurvedic doctor blended for her. And it was not half as expensive as the one that’s sold.The only thing that really does knock the charts off is the date and lichee night cream. The only good skincare item.Oh and did I forget to mention? The Rose cardamom body spray, the rose surround spray and the rose perfume do not smell very different from each other?And the toners/hydrosol bottles too, leak when spraying. They don’t just spray a lot, they also leak! I have tried 3-4 of those bottles. It’s not just one defective product, as I too decided that it was, until every other bottle nozzle would do the same! I’m not paying 2k+ for pretty (read: cheap) packaging you know.And the mashobra honey face cleanser is a super mild version of this kashmir saffron cleanser with a couple extra ingredients tossed and taken off the list. Not much difference there.Still want to go ahead and get their products? Sure do, it’s everyone's prerogative to be associated with whoever or whatever. One may pay for the pretty packaging that’s defective I guess.And for the customer support? No. Just no.Someone (I do not wish to take any names) on support team via email, replies to a part of your message and not all of it. Deliberate effort to avoid replying to a part of a message multiple times. (PS:) I tried asking from separate emails (different timelines) just to check if it’s just me or are they really trying to avoid certain questions (and yes they are).It is as though they are trying to avoid giving out information even though, I, as a customer am entitled to that information. What I mean is, the questions weren’t wrong or avoidable either. As a customer you have the right to know what ingredients go in a product whether chemical or not. This should not be too difficult to answer. I have not completely knocked chemicals off my skincare just yet, so it does not make a difference to me to know if it’s completely ‘natural’ or not! I just want to know.They pride themselves on absolutely nothing but deception and ornate packaging. I laugh.I am not surprised that we are being cheated the way that we are because well, who runs on integrity these days, deceit is the new black, deception is the fuel.Also, ONLY IF this particular review is beneficial to you or to your family, then please do share (screenshot, perhaps). Because my review was taken down last time (sorry the product I reviewed was taken down to keep this review from showing, and so my review went down with it)Edited to add: If you purchase here, you’ll receive low-quality stock that smells old/rancid because they think rejects can be sold here and they won’t be questioned about it. You will not find the stuff they sell in their retail outlets here because they can get away with it here.Hope this helps someone!PS: If this review does not appear as verified purchase then please rest assured that I only review products I own. For this product may not have been purchased from amazon but an alternate account, received as a sample, a gift or may have been purchased in store.

column1: Disappointing Product and even more disappointing Customer Support
column3: I am not able to decide whether I am more disappointed in the Forest Essential product or the callous attitude of the customer support team. I had bought Forest Essentials Kashmiri Saffron and Neem Delicate Facial Cleanser, 200mlI from their official website and developed rashes and boils on my face after using the product and used the contact form on the Forest Essential website to bring this to their attention. There was no response to it. In my grievance I had even mentioned that the same thing had happened with me when I had bought another Forest Essential product almost a year ago and contacted customer support team in vain.So in my experience Forest Essential has failed me twice consistently and without any regret or remorse.This was clearly my last purchase from Forest Essentials.
Very expensive and nothing unique for this price

column1: The saffron scent is very nice. Please remember
column3: I have been using this for over an year now. The saffron scent is very nice. Please remember, this is a mild cleanser. It will not work well to remove oil or grime in hot or humid weather. It is pretty good for winter when you would need a mild cleanser.I like that it not very soapy, not too much detergent and it is easy to wash off. However, as stated before, it doesn't give that 'clean' feeling most of the time.

column1: Good for summers not monsoons and for normal and dry skin, not oily skin...
column3: This product is really good in summer..it is soft , very mild but stress relieving fragnance..cleanse well and leaves the skin soft, and smooth and requires just one pump..however it cant combate monsoons and loses its potency...My skin is oily hence it cant help much...hence I am using ponds age miracle face wash which I find is more potent than this one during monsoons...I may use this again during winter and of course it expensive...bought this from the store...

nice, loved it, smooth skin after applying, genuine product makes ur skin good. Strongly recommended go for it

I almost never repeat face washes unless and until it really impresses me. I  started with pond’s and pears face wash ( I used to buy them with my pocket money since the concept of face washes was new and my Mumma thought it as another one of my crazy expenses.)PROS:The fact that it is chemical free!!!!The amazing refreshing smell.Gives an instant glow to my face.I have noticed a teeny reduction of my gigantic pores after I have started using it but I am also using Fabindia rose water so i guess it is a joined effort of both the products.It is suitable for all skin types..even sensitive skin.A very small quantity is required for one wash hence it will last me a loong time.Does not dry my skin. Although I have combination skin I do not like face washes that strip my face of all the moisture.CONSI cannot think of anything except the price.But I am willing to spend this much on a fab product like this.And since it is too mild i mean if you have travelled and have all that grime and dust on your face..i feel using this face wash only wont give you a squeaky clean feel because it lathers very less. I therefore don’t use it after I come home in the evening after office.

column1: Average Results / Strong Rose scent / Review after using entire bottle
column3: I got this delivered in March 2nd week and the bottle has almost come to end; I use it mostly once or max twice a day to wash my face - so lasted about 3-3.5 month for one person. You need very small quantity of it to wash.The face wash has strong rose scent - initially -  it is overpowering but you get used to it. No other notes are discernible except for rose.There is no visible change to face as such but it is not a drying face wash , i have combination skin and I did not notice any drying ; on contrary I feel it does not clear out oil on nose very well and I had use to charcoal nose -strip every week to remove white heads.Overall - my verdict is that it is a mild face wash with a slightly over powering rose scent ; the Neem & saffron face wash of same brand has better fragrance ( I have used that one as well) .  Also - it is not 100% chemical free just that it is a glycerin/honey based face wash. but this also contains Tochopheryl Acetate.Buy it - if you have money and extra sensitive skin ; otherwise do not expect any dramatic results for your skin.If my review has helped you - pls press helpful.
Rate is so high. Neither impressed nor disappointed. Okayish experience with forest essential
Super
Loved its fragrance. Though pricey, it lasted for a long time.

The face cleanser is beautifully rose scented. Just a little bit is enough to wash the face well. My skin felt alive and supple after use. After sampling this will certainly purchase the bigger quantity.
Excellent face wash

column1: I have to pay for this product Rs 425 but the MRP is  Rs 350

column3: I do not like the new packaging. It has a bigger opening due to which a large amount of liquid comes out. I think there is some problem with the cap too. There is a plastic cover stuck inside the cap which does not come out. This problem was not there in the previous packaging.

column1: Haven’t had Acne/Pimples since 6months! Wonder Wash!
column3: I was introduced to Forest Essentials facewash by a friend in Jan’20 and since then I have stuck to this brand of facewash only. I haven’t had a breakout of acne/pimples since Jan’20 which otherwise I had every month! Very refreshing and light on the skin, I use it daily, and a small amount works wonders! I keep switching between this one and saffron neem one from the same brand. A small bottle lasts me months, may be because I mostly use it once a day only. Have tried all herbal and non herbal brands(Indian and Foreign) but nothing has helped me to keep a tight check on pimples/clear skin as Forest Essentials Face Cleanser! Go for it. Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.

I am 34+ years old. It worked well on my skin making it healthy and has got the young look, removed all the hard layer of my skin. Overall product is good, except it is comedogenic. I got black heads and blackness all over my nose. Check on it.
It's very nice facial cleanser, suited to my skin. You can also try it once.

I have a very sensitive skin. I do get a lot of breakouts and have also been reluctant in using any face wash or face cream. I came across this product which was a gift. I loved the smell and used it for a while. And here I am now for the third time. It's really good and just a tiny drop is enough for whole face. It worked for me. As long as side effects is concerned..been using it for a year but never had any. It's a good buy :)

I've been using this for a few months now. I swear by this face wash. It's very gentle on your skin, has the right amount of lather and smells heavenly! You only need one pump to get enough product per use and it lasts for a very long time. It may not be effective in removing heavy make up, which works fine for me.Given the fact that it lasts for a long time, the high price is ok.

This is a great product. I m very particualr in chosing all natural ingredient products and this has kept up all my expectations. It removes all the oil and dirt from skin. I like the neem kesar face wash more since it suits my skin more.

This facial cleanser needs recognition!After buying this TWICE for my teenage sibling, my partner and myself at their outlets, I finally ordered this online. Not only was it delivered on the same day (I placed the order before 8am), the packaging is exactly as seen in stores and I didn't have to leave the house!This cleanser is phenomenal. My skin is extremely sensitive and scar prone. I use this as many as 6 times a day and my skin retains it's moisture and surprisingly hasn't broken out. Lasts for about 2 months, so for the price, it's a win!

column1: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all
column3: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all. I have been using it for more than a month now. Has a very pleasant smell and leaves the skin magically supple. All that dreamy stuff is true. But the basic purpose of a cleaner is to clean. No matter how much quantity you use and how much you try to massage your face with it, the dirt and grime doesn't come off. You will feel nice and delicate and then you go back and check with a little toner on a cotton ball, there will still be dirt on it. Boy, you could only use a cloth instead and you will still see dirt left over on your 'supple nice smelling' face. It's useless. Maybe an apt product for a posh homemaker who never leaves the four walls but not for the regular person. For what it costs, I'd get much better products in other brands which provide these additional 'features' in addition to performing its basic function - cleaning!

column1: Deception and Forest Essentials are Synonyms
column3: The nozzles on all their bottles are 5 out of 10 times either broken or LEAKY.I have managed to purchase 75% of all of their products — minus the soaps, body oils, hair oils and dusting powders (because who even pays a fortune for your regular organic soap/oil that I can whip up at home! Or better yet, get an excellent alternative elsewhere!)Anyhow, I mailed them to ask for the ingredients list of certain products because they are super secretive about what goes into their “all natural” range of skincare. What did I find?Nothing special.They lie to the customers (foreign customers) and run on deception. For example: NARANGI IS ORANGE!Now, the ingredients list would have English names and then there’s “narangi extract”, narangi peel powder, etc.(???)Why?!Let me tell you what I have figured from testing about 20-30 products of theirs:• flimsy packaging in the name of “reducing plastic”.• clever way of using the kind of spray nozzles that spray so much you’ll be done with the bottle before you start noticing a difference/change.(I have preferred to transfer them into a bottle of rose water from another brand, and that fixed the problem for me because I really like the panchpushp!)• The products aren’t all bad but they’re not anything special. The effect that makes you go wow wears off as your skin adapts to their products (tested this on a few skin types).• their room surround spray nozzles leak heavily. They have completely removed any seals from room sprays!!! They evaporate!!! Why would you risk having something be spilled by children or even adults with loose room spray nozzles!?I had to find a way to hold the lid in place along with the nozzle. Every time I open the nozzle there’s tonnes of evaporated spray + oils spilled onto the inside of the lid and on the spray nozzle.• complete cheapskates. I purchased ALL five of their ubtan range and each of them have just 1-2 at most 3 different ingredients which make them “unique” so you’re forced to purchase the others. The rest of the ingredients are the exact same or repeated!All in the name of profits, sales, and “luxurious Ayurveda”.• Some of their products like the orange and sandalwood moisturizer, quality and formulation are both sub par.• I hope we have all been familiarized with the fair and lovely scent? Their velvet silk cream moisturizer smells the exact same. A total ripoff! And super greasy (my humble apologies to the acne-prone / combination skin bearers).I speak from experience with blending, mixing, pounding and formulating my own skincare for years.I own (in total) over 70 essential + carrier oils and herbal tinctures + powdered products. I know what I’m talking about.It is when you purchase a set of all products from a range (like all 5 ubtan mixes they offer, or all of different rose spray, perfume and room spray etc) is when you realize how you’re being tricked by pretty packaging and some fake reviews (yes I said fake!)The website at least has 90% reviews that are not by real customers. Because who repetitively uses the title “Forest Essentials” over and over in a review, OR, who has the time to write the product name exactly as it is with certain reiterated vocabulary in each and every review?I mean, come on! *scoffs*The ojas balm smells like my mother‘s pain  relief oil that her Ayurvedic doctor blended for her. And it was not half as expensive as the one that’s sold.The only thing that really does knock the charts off is the date and lichee night cream. The only good skincare item.Oh and did I forget to mention? The Rose cardamom body spray, the rose surround spray and the rose perfume do not smell very different from each other?And the toners/hydrosol bottles too, leak when spraying. They don’t just spray a lot, they also leak! I have tried 3-4 of those bottles. It’s not just one defective product, as I too decided that it was, until every other bottle nozzle would do the same! I’m not paying 2k+ for pretty (read: cheap) packaging you know.And the mashobra honey face cleanser is a super mild version of this kashmir saffron cleanser with a couple extra ingredients tossed and taken off the list. Not much difference there.Still want to go ahead and get their products? Sure do, it’s everyone's prerogative to be associated with whoever or whatever. One may pay for the pretty packaging that’s defective I guess.And for the customer support? No. Just no.Someone (I do not wish to take any names) on support team via email, replies to a part of your message and not all of it. Deliberate effort to avoid replying to a part of a message multiple times. (PS:) I tried asking from separate emails (different timelines) just to check if it’s just me or are they really trying to avoid certain questions (and yes they are).It is as though they are trying to avoid giving out information even though, I, as a customer am entitled to that information. What I mean is, the questions weren’t wrong or avoidable either. As a customer you have the right to know what ingredients go in a product whether chemical or not. This should not be too difficult to answer. I have not completely knocked chemicals off my skincare just yet, so it does not make a difference to me to know if it’s completely ‘natural’ or not! I just want to know.They pride themselves on absolutely nothing but deception and ornate packaging. I laugh.I am not surprised that we are being cheated the way that we are because well, who runs on integrity these days, deceit is the new black, deception is the fuel.Also, ONLY IF this particular review is beneficial to you or to your family, then please do share (screenshot, perhaps). Because my review was taken down last time (sorry the product I reviewed was taken down to keep this review from showing, and so my review went down with it)Edited to add: If you purchase here, you’ll receive low-quality stock that smells old/rancid because they think rejects can be sold here and they won’t be questioned about it. You will not find the stuff they sell in their retail outlets here because they can get away with it here.Hope this helps someone!PS: If this review does not appear as verified purchase then please rest assured that I only review products I own. For this product may not have been purchased from amazon but an alternate account, received as a sample, a gift or may have been purchased in store.

column1: Disappointing Product and even more disappointing Customer Support
column3: I am not able to decide whether I am more disappointed in the Forest Essential product or the callous attitude of the customer support team. I had bought Forest Essentials Kashmiri Saffron and Neem Delicate Facial Cleanser, 200mlI from their official website and developed rashes and boils on my face after using the product and used the contact form on the Forest Essential website to bring this to their attention. There was no response to it. In my grievance I had even mentioned that the same thing had happened with me when I had bought another Forest Essential product almost a year ago and contacted customer support team in vain.So in my experience Forest Essential has failed me twice consistently and without any regret or remorse.This was clearly my last purchase from Forest Essentials.

It's a wonder for my oily skin, though it takes time to see the results but after few days, i can feel my face being oil free. It smell pleasant and refreshing.
Very good 👍

column1: It lathers a lot less than usual facewashes but atleast i am satisfied i am using natural stuff
column3: I picked up a tiny bottle of this face wash from the FE store  to try it out. Exotic mild fragrance ,completely natural and skin did feel very cleansed ,soft and clear. Will use this more often. It lathers a lot less than usual facewashes but atleast i am satisfied i am using natural stuff. A star less for being soo expensive .

column1: Good for summers not monsoons and for normal and dry skin, not oily skin...
column3: This product is really good in summer..it is soft , very mild but stress relieving fragnance..cleanse well and leaves the skin soft, and smooth and requires just one pump..however it cant combate monsoons and loses its potency...My skin is oily hence it cant help much...hence I am using ponds age miracle face wash which I find is more potent than this one during monsoons...I may use this again during winter and of course it expensive...bought this from the store...
My wife loves this. She has never used a such a gentle face wash and it leaves her skin looking and feeling so very supple. And the fragrance is simply amazing!
It is an excellent cleanser for oily skin type. My skin texture has improved immensely. It has a very calming and soothing fragrance too. It gently cleanses the skin and is very mild.
nice, loved it, smooth skin after applying, genuine product makes ur skin good. Strongly recommended go for it

I almost never repeat face washes unless and until it really impresses me. I  started with pond’s and pears face wash ( I used to buy them with my pocket money since the concept of face washes was new and my Mumma thought it as another one of my crazy expenses.)PROS:The fact that it is chemical free!!!!The amazing refreshing smell.Gives an instant glow to my face.I have noticed a teeny reduction of my gigantic pores after I have started using it but I am also using Fabindia rose water so i guess it is a joined effort of both the products.It is suitable for all skin types..even sensitive skin.A very small quantity is required for one wash hence it will last me a loong time.Does not dry my skin. Although I have combination skin I do not like face washes that strip my face of all the moisture.CONSI cannot think of anything except the price.But I am willing to spend this much on a fab product like this.And since it is too mild i mean if you have travelled and have all that grime and dust on your face..i feel using this face wash only wont give you a squeaky clean feel because it lathers very less. I therefore don’t use it after I come home in the evening after office.

Used for couple of days. But trust me, nothing works better than Kama rose jasmine facial cleanser for a combination skin specially which looks oily but feels dry.

column1: Average Results / Strong Rose scent / Review after using entire bottle
column3: I got this delivered in March 2nd week and the bottle has almost come to end; I use it mostly once or max twice a day to wash my face - so lasted about 3-3.5 month for one person. You need very small quantity of it to wash.The face wash has strong rose scent - initially -  it is overpowering but you get used to it. No other notes are discernible except for rose.There is no visible change to face as such but it is not a drying face wash , i have combination skin and I did not notice any drying ; on contrary I feel it does not clear out oil on nose very well and I had use to charcoal nose -strip every week to remove white heads.Overall - my verdict is that it is a mild face wash with a slightly over powering rose scent ; the Neem & saffron face wash of same brand has better fragrance ( I have used that one as well) .  Also - it is not 100% chemical free just that it is a glycerin/honey based face wash. but this also contains Tochopheryl Acetate.Buy it - if you have money and extra sensitive skin ; otherwise do not expect any dramatic results for your skin.If my review has helped you - pls press helpful.
Rate is so high. Neither impressed nor disappointed. Okayish experience with forest essential
Super
Loved its fragrance. Though pricey, it lasted for a long time.

The face cleanser is beautifully rose scented. Just a little bit is enough to wash the face well. My skin felt alive and supple after use. After sampling this will certainly purchase the bigger quantity.
Excellent face wash

column1: I have to pay for this product Rs 425 but the MRP is  Rs 350

column3: I do not like the new packaging. It has a bigger opening due to which a large amount of liquid comes out. I think there is some problem with the cap too. There is a plastic cover stuck inside the cap which does not come out. This problem was not there in the previous packaging.

column1: Haven’t had Acne/Pimples since 6months! Wonder Wash!
column3: I was introduced to Forest Essentials facewash by a friend in Jan’20 and since then I have stuck to this brand of facewash only. I haven’t had a breakout of acne/pimples since Jan’20 which otherwise I had every month! Very refreshing and light on the skin, I use it daily, and a small amount works wonders! I keep switching between this one and saffron neem one from the same brand. A small bottle lasts me months, may be because I mostly use it once a day only. Have tried all herbal and non herbal brands(Indian and Foreign) but nothing has helped me to keep a tight check on pimples/clear skin as Forest Essentials Face Cleanser! Go for it. Try with a small size to check your skin compatibility.

I am 34+ years old. It worked well on my skin making it healthy and has got the young look, removed all the hard layer of my skin. Overall product is good, except it is comedogenic. I got black heads and blackness all over my nose. Check on it.
It's very nice facial cleanser, suited to my skin. You can also try it once.

I have a very sensitive skin. I do get a lot of breakouts and have also been reluctant in using any face wash or face cream. I came across this product which was a gift. I loved the smell and used it for a while. And here I am now for the third time. It's really good and just a tiny drop is enough for whole face. It worked for me. As long as side effects is concerned..been using it for a year but never had any. It's a good buy :)

I've been using this for a few months now. I swear by this face wash. It's very gentle on your skin, has the right amount of lather and smells heavenly! You only need one pump to get enough product per use and it lasts for a very long time. It may not be effective in removing heavy make up, which works fine for me.Given the fact that it lasts for a long time, the high price is ok.

This is a great product. I m very particualr in chosing all natural ingredient products and this has kept up all my expectations. It removes all the oil and dirt from skin. I like the neem kesar face wash more since it suits my skin more.

This facial cleanser needs recognition!After buying this TWICE for my teenage sibling, my partner and myself at their outlets, I finally ordered this online. Not only was it delivered on the same day (I placed the order before 8am), the packaging is exactly as seen in stores and I didn't have to leave the house!This cleanser is phenomenal. My skin is extremely sensitive and scar prone. I use this as many as 6 times a day and my skin retains it's moisture and surprisingly hasn't broken out. Lasts for about 2 months, so for the price, it's a win!

column1: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all
column3: Horrible Product. Doesn't work at all. I have been using it for more than a month now. Has a very pleasant smell and leaves the skin magically supple. All that dreamy stuff is true. But the basic purpose of a cleaner is to clean. No matter how much quantity you use and how much you try to massage your face with it, the dirt and grime doesn't come off. You will feel nice and delicate and then you go back and check with a little toner on a cotton ball, there will still be dirt on it. Boy, you could only use a cloth instead and you will still see dirt left over on your 'supple nice smelling' face. It's useless. Maybe an apt product for a posh homemaker who never leaves the four walls but not for the regular person. For what it costs, I'd get much better products in other brands which provide these additional 'features' in addition to performing its basic function - cleaning!
