This product works wonders. The skin texture drastically improved after continued use.It smells of beautiful jasmine and frankincense as their pure essential oils are in it.It has no artificial fragrance, neither any surfactants. It only has saponified oils, hydrosols and essential oils.Essentials oils used are well below dermal limits and it's an ECOCERT and cosmos certified brand. Absolutely love it and 100% trust it.
The product is great in Nature, the scent is a little strong though. Definitely should give a try. Works wonders on Skin!
Quality and ingredients is superb , clean well and skin feel soft. Totally organic product. Just go for it .

I am currently using my 3rd bottle. My skin type is sensitive-dry-acne prone. I'm never going back to another face wash. This one's gentle but is strong enough to remove cleansing balms/oils from face. Has a spa like smell which i love. One pump is usually enough for me to wash my face and lathers pretty well for a 100% certified organic face wash. Thank you JC

column1: Gentle, Effective Face Wash; Smells Like an Exotic Fruit Market
column3: I've experimented with a lot of different face washes; my sensitive skin requires something gentle, and I prefer cleansers that rinse cleanly. (Some "moisturizing" formulas leave a filmy layer behind on my face.) This Juicy Chemistry face wash meets both of my requirements; it doesn't irritate my sensitive skin in the slightest, and even though its ingredients contain several different oils, they don't leave a greasy or waxy film behind.As some other reviewers have noted, this face wash has a rather unusual scent; it reminded me of the aromas of ripe fruits in the outdoor markets of French Polynesia or South Asia. (Perhaps that's not surprising, considering this  cleanser is made in India.) As a vegetarian, the fact that this product is cruelty-free, vegan, organic, and 100% natural is important to me.Overall, I'm really pleased with this Juicy Chemistry Tamanu, Kakadu Plum & Frankincense Organic Face Wash, and I feel it's a very good value for the price. The only reason I rated it 4 stars rather than 5 is because it has a somewhat runny consistency; if you're not careful, the cleanser may leak between your fingers before you have a chance to apply it to your face. (I dispensed some into my hand for one of my review photos, and you can see how it settled into the groove between two fingers.) But I do like the product a lot, and would order it again.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2020

column3: I love the way Juicy Chemistry's face wash feels. It has a smooth, silky texture and doesn't leave my skin dry. The ingredients are great. I was expecting it to smell earthy, like frankincense. Instead, it is very cloying. It has a super intense floral fragrance that I don't enjoy. The fragrance lingers for awhile as well. I am still using the face wash, but the fragrance is too much for me.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2020

column1: Good Face Wash But Peculiar Scent!
column3: In my opinion, this face wash is just okay. It does lather a little, and my face actually felt squeaky clean. However, what I didn't care for is the scent. I don't even know how to describe it. It's not a pleasant perfumy scent... And, I don't think it's the Frankincense. I'm just not sure what it is.I hope you find this helpful!
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2020

column1: For Those Who Prefer An Oil Based Cleanser
column3: An okay facial cleanser but for those who prefer a nice oil based cleanser. Oil dissolves and helps to remove other oils you need replacing in order to get your face nice and clean without stripping it of essential oils. It works and is something that I prefer to use between other cleansers. Like my shampoos, I like to swap around with my cleansers to get the best that each has to offer. This is a good cleanser when I want something that's not so stripping or too thick with ceramides and such.Honestly, this is something that I would expect to pick up in a health food store. It just has that certain something that you would expect to find there. Different, natural and effective but won't necessarily appeal to the general public. Partly because of the scent. A bit strong and not really something most would consider pleasant. Not really bad though either. Have to admit that I do get a kick out of using something with frankincense around Christmas time. Frankincense is one of those cleansing ingredients and has beneficial properties which is partly what has made it so valuable over thousands of years.This is good but needs to find its own market. Even though the scent is strong, it's gentle but effective.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2020

column3: This is a great serum for moisturizing your face. As far as it's other claims of helping with scars and pigmentation, I'm not convinced of that yet, but am willing to continue using it at least until the bottle runs out.  I'll be patient because I know it takes several weeks to start seeing results from products like this.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2021

column3: I love how this feels on my face, but I don't absolutely love how it smells. It isn't horrible, but it isn't my favorite. That being said it does enough for my really dry skin that I just don't care at all if it is my fav scent! The bottle is medium-sized - I'd say it is about a month's supply, so depending on your skin care budget, this is a great option for those of us with really dry skin.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 28 March 2021

column3: I love the way Juicy Chemistry's face wash feels. It has a smooth, silky texture and doesn't leave my skin dry. The ingredients are great. I was expecting it to smell earthy, like frankincense. Instead, it is very cloying. It has a super intense floral fragrance that I don't enjoy. The fragrance lingers for awhile as well. I am still using the face wash, but the fragrance is too much for me.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2020

column1: Good Face Wash But Peculiar Scent!
column3: In my opinion, this face wash is just okay. It does lather a little, and my face actually felt squeaky clean. However, what I didn't care for is the scent. I don't even know how to describe it. It's not a pleasant perfumy scent... And, I don't think it's the Frankincense. I'm just not sure what it is.I hope you find this helpful!
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2020

column1: For Those Who Prefer An Oil Based Cleanser
column3: An okay facial cleanser but for those who prefer a nice oil based cleanser. Oil dissolves and helps to remove other oils you need replacing in order to get your face nice and clean without stripping it of essential oils. It works and is something that I prefer to use between other cleansers. Like my shampoos, I like to swap around with my cleansers to get the best that each has to offer. This is a good cleanser when I want something that's not so stripping or too thick with ceramides and such.Honestly, this is something that I would expect to pick up in a health food store. It just has that certain something that you would expect to find there. Different, natural and effective but won't necessarily appeal to the general public. Partly because of the scent. A bit strong and not really something most would consider pleasant. Not really bad though either. Have to admit that I do get a kick out of using something with frankincense around Christmas time. Frankincense is one of those cleansing ingredients and has beneficial properties which is partly what has made it so valuable over thousands of years.This is good but needs to find its own market. Even though the scent is strong, it's gentle but effective.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2020

column3: This is a great serum for moisturizing your face. As far as it's other claims of helping with scars and pigmentation, I'm not convinced of that yet, but am willing to continue using it at least until the bottle runs out.  I'll be patient because I know it takes several weeks to start seeing results from products like this.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2021

column3: I love how this feels on my face, but I don't absolutely love how it smells. It isn't horrible, but it isn't my favorite. That being said it does enough for my really dry skin that I just don't care at all if it is my fav scent! The bottle is medium-sized - I'd say it is about a month's supply, so depending on your skin care budget, this is a great option for those of us with really dry skin.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 28 March 2021

column3: This product works wonders. The skin texture drastically improved after continued use.It smells of beautiful jasmine and frankincense as their pure essential oils are in it.It has no artificial fragrance, neither any surfactants. It only has saponified oils, hydrosols and essential oils.Essentials oils used are well below dermal limits and it's an ECOCERT and cosmos certified brand. Absolutely love it and 100% trust it.
The product is great in Nature, the scent is a little strong though. Definitely should give a try. Works wonders on Skin!
Quality and ingredients is superb , clean well and skin feel soft. Totally organic product. Just go for it .

I am currently using my 3rd bottle. My skin type is sensitive-dry-acne prone. I'm never going back to another face wash. This one's gentle but is strong enough to remove cleansing balms/oils from face. Has a spa like smell which i love. One pump is usually enough for me to wash my face and lathers pretty well for a 100% certified organic face wash. Thank you JC

column1: Gentle, Effective Face Wash; Smells Like an Exotic Fruit Market
column3: I've experimented with a lot of different face washes; my sensitive skin requires something gentle, and I prefer cleansers that rinse cleanly. (Some "moisturizing" formulas leave a filmy layer behind on my face.) This Juicy Chemistry face wash meets both of my requirements; it doesn't irritate my sensitive skin in the slightest, and even though its ingredients contain several different oils, they don't leave a greasy or waxy film behind.As some other reviewers have noted, this face wash has a rather unusual scent; it reminded me of the aromas of ripe fruits in the outdoor markets of French Polynesia or South Asia. (Perhaps that's not surprising, considering this  cleanser is made in India.) As a vegetarian, the fact that this product is cruelty-free, vegan, organic, and 100% natural is important to me.Overall, I'm really pleased with this Juicy Chemistry Tamanu, Kakadu Plum & Frankincense Organic Face Wash, and I feel it's a very good value for the price. The only reason I rated it 4 stars rather than 5 is because it has a somewhat runny consistency; if you're not careful, the cleanser may leak between your fingers before you have a chance to apply it to your face. (I dispensed some into my hand for one of my review photos, and you can see how it settled into the groove between two fingers.) But I do like the product a lot, and would order it again.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2020

column3: I love the way Juicy Chemistry's face wash feels. It has a smooth, silky texture and doesn't leave my skin dry. The ingredients are great. As a vegetarian, the fact that this product is cruelty-free, vegan, organic, and 100% natural is important to me.Overall, I'm really pleased with this Juicy Chemistry Tamanu, Kakadu Plum & Frankincense Organic Face Wash, and I feel it's a very good value for the price. The only reason I rated it 4 stars rather than 5 is because it has a somewhat runny consistency; if you're not careful, the cleanser may leak between your fingers before you have a chance to apply it to your face. (I dispensed some into my hand for one of my review photos, and you can see how it settled into the groove between two fingers.) But I do like the product a lot, and would order it again.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2020

column3: I love the way Juicy Chemistry's face wash feels. It has a smooth, silky texture and doesn't leave my skin dry. The ingredients are great. I was expecting it to smell earthy, like frankincense. Instead, it is very cloying. It has a super intense floral fragrance that I don't enjoy. The fragrance lingers for awhile as well. I am still using the face wash, but the fragrance is too much for me.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2020

column1: Good Face Wash But Peculiar Scent!
column3: In my opinion, this face wash is just okay. It does lather a little, and my face actually felt squeaky clean. However, what I didn't care for is the scent. I don't even know how to describe it. It's not a pleasant perfumy scent... And, I don't think it's the Frankincense. I'm just not sure what it is.I hope you find this helpful!
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2020

column1: For Those Who Prefer An Oil Based Cleanser
column3: An okay facial cleanser but for those who prefer a nice oil based cleanser. Oil dissolves and helps to remove other oils you need replacing in order to get your face nice and clean without stripping it of essential oils. It works and is something that I prefer to use between other cleansers. Like my shampoos, I like to swap around with my cleansers to get the best that each has to offer. This is a good cleanser when I want something that's not so stripping or too thick with ceramides and such.Honestly, this is something that I would expect to pick up in a health food store. It just has that certain something that you would expect to find there. Different, natural and effective but won't necessarily appeal to the general public. Partly because of the scent. A bit strong and not really something most would consider pleasant. Not really bad though either. Have to admit that I do get a kick out of using something with frankincense around Christmas time. Frankincense is one of those cleansing ingredients and has beneficial properties which is partly what has made it so valuable over thousands of years.This is good but needs to find its own market. Even though the scent is strong, it's gentle but effective.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2020

column3: This is a great serum for moisturizing your face. As far as it's other claims of helping with scars and pigmentation, I'm not convinced of that yet, but am willing to continue using it at least until the bottle runs out.  I'll be patient because I know it takes several weeks to start seeing results from products like this.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2021

column3: I love how this feels on my face, but I don't absolutely love how it smells. It isn't horrible, but it isn't my favorite. One pump is usually enough for me to wash my face and lathers pretty well for a 100% certified organic face wash. Thank you JC

column1: Gentle, Effective Face Wash; Smells Like an Exotic Fruit Market
column3: I've experimented with a lot of different face washes; my sensitive skin requires something gentle, and I prefer cleansers that rinse cleanly. (Some "moisturizing" formulas leave a filmy layer behind on my face.) This Juicy Chemistry face wash meets both of my requirements; it doesn't irritate my sensitive skin in the slightest, and even though its ingredients contain several different oils, they don't leave a greasy or waxy film behind.As some other reviewers have noted, this face wash has a rather unusual scent; it reminded me of the aromas of ripe fruits in the outdoor markets of French Polynesia or South Asia. (Perhaps that's not surprising, considering this  cleanser is made in India.) As a vegetarian, the fact that this product is cruelty-free, vegan, organic, and 100% natural is important to me.Overall, I'm really pleased with this Juicy Chemistry Tamanu, Kakadu Plum & Frankincense Organic Face Wash, and I feel it's a very good value for the price. The only reason I rated it 4 stars rather than 5 is because it has a somewhat runny consistency; if you're not careful, the cleanser may leak between your fingers before you have a chance to apply it to your face. (I dispensed some into my hand for one of my review photos, and you can see how it settled into the groove between two fingers.) But I do like the product a lot, and would order it again.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 23 December 2020

column3: I love the way Juicy Chemistry's face wash feels. It has a smooth, silky texture and doesn't leave my skin dry. The ingredients are great. I was expecting it to smell earthy, like frankincense. Instead, it is very cloying. It has a super intense floral fragrance that I don't enjoy. The fragrance lingers for awhile as well. I am still using the face wash, but the fragrance is too much for me.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2020

column1: Good Face Wash But Peculiar Scent!
column3: In my opinion, this face wash is just okay. It does lather a little, and my face actually felt squeaky clean. However, what I didn't care for is the scent. I don't even know how to describe it. It's not a pleasant perfumy scent... And, I don't think it's the Frankincense. I'm just not sure what it is.I hope you find this helpful!
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2020

column1: For Those Who Prefer An Oil Based Cleanser
column3: An okay facial cleanser but for those who prefer a nice oil based cleanser. Oil dissolves and helps to remove other oils you need replacing in order to get your face nice and clean without stripping it of essential oils. It works and is something that I prefer to use between other cleansers. Like my shampoos, I like to swap around with my cleansers to get the best that each has to offer. This is a good cleanser when I want something that's not so stripping or too thick with ceramides and such.Honestly, this is something that I would expect to pick up in a health food store. It just has that certain something that you would expect to find there. Different, natural and effective but won't necessarily appeal to the general public. Partly because of the scent. A bit strong and not really something most would consider pleasant. Not really bad though either. Have to admit that I do get a kick out of using something with frankincense around Christmas time. Frankincense is one of those cleansing ingredients and has beneficial properties which is partly what has made it so valuable over thousands of years.This is good but needs to find its own market. Even though the scent is strong, it's gentle but effective.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 December 2020

column3: This is a great serum for moisturizing your face. As far as it's other claims of helping with scars and pigmentation, I'm not convinced of that yet, but am willing to continue using it at least until the bottle runs out.  I'll be patient because I know it takes several weeks to start seeing results from products like this.
column4: Reviewed in the United States on 18 January 2021

column3: I love how this feels on my face, but I don't absolutely love how it smells. It isn't horrible, but it isn't my favorite. That being said it does enough for my really dry skin that I just don't care at all if it is my fav scent! The bottle is medium-sized - I'd say it is about a month's supply, so depending on your skin care budget, this is a great option for those of us with really dry skin.

column1: My hair became soo shinny and silky

That problem has also gone after using this product.I am so pleased with this hair mask that I had to share my experience with you all.

I have pretty dry 3B curly hair with split ends and a dandruff prone scalp that makes my hairfall worse and my hair growth slow. I tried many masks in the Indian market like Mamaearth's Argan Oil Mask and TRESemme's Keratin Hair Mask. While both of those were good for softening and adding some shine to my curls, they weren't so good at fighting the main issues of my scalp. However, this Just Herbs mask has done just that! I have always loved Just Herbs as a brand and tried it's other wonderful products, so I already had pretty high expectations from this product. The three main ingredients of amla, bhringraj, and shankhpushpi did wonders for my hair after a month of use (once a week for 4 weeks). The amla helped make my hair soft and smooth as well as increased hair growth a little. The bhringraj helped reduce my dandruff for a smoother, less flakier scalp, while the shankhpushpi helped reduce my hairfall. All in all, I have never found a product that helps solve all my hair problems at once before trying out this mask! I recommend it to people of all hair types, since I will also definitely be repurchasing this product.

column1: My hair became soo shinny and silky
column3: I was so excited to use this Shirolepam #hairmask from @justherbsindia So, without wasting any minute I ordered it from @amazondotin and got it within 2 days. That problem has also gone after using this product.I am so pleased with this hair mask that I had to share my experience with you all.

I have pretty dry 3B curly hair with split ends and a dandruff prone scalp that makes my hairfall worse and my hair growth slow. I tried many masks in the Indian market like Mamaearth's Argan Oil Mask and TRESemme's Keratin Hair Mask. While both of those were good for softening and adding some shine to my curls, they weren't so good at fighting the main issues of my scalp. However, this Just Herbs mask has done just that! I have always loved Just Herbs as a brand and tried it's other wonderful products, so I already had pretty high expectations from this product. The three main ingredients of amla, bhringraj, and shankhpushpi did wonders for my hair after a month of use (once a week for 4 weeks). The amla helped make my hair soft and smooth as well as increased hair growth a little. The bhringraj helped reduce my dandruff for a smoother, less flakier scalp, while the shankhpushpi helped reduce my hairfall. All in all, I have never found a product that helps solve all my hair problems at once before trying out this mask! I recommend it to people of all hair types, since I will also definitely be repurchasing this product.

LONG REVIEW !This package of 16 color is absolutely worth buying. Before buying I was seeing the reviews and saw some people saying that this is very fragile and they broke easily. However,I still went ahead and bought it.Boss , what do you want in such a competitive price? Handle it carefully thats it.I have tried 4-5 color so far and loved them. Texture and feel are so good. People said it has good smell, but I didn’t feel any smell as such. It could be a mild smell there.Pros1. First of all getting 16 shades in just Rs 488 discounted price is a steal deal.2. These are Ayurvedic and made up of natural ingredients3. It stays for good 3-4 hrs which is still fine4. Gives moisture to your lips5. All shades are good and goes with all type of skin colour6. The smaller size is actually good as you buy big lipsticks which end up getting wasted after their expiry. This is a great deal if you want to save 1000s of Rs spent on lipstick and not use it completely.Cons (personally not a con for me)1. Since these are very small and when you close the cap you may end up breaking it. But dude, you have got a very good deal. You can handle it carefully. Don’t apply much pressure. Apply side ways rather than placing directly on lips from tip.2. Rather than giving in lipsticks shape, it could have been given in palatte3. It doesn’t stay for long but its fine you can re apply4. Not smudge proof (Not a con for me personally) . That way it becomes easy to remove itOverall it’s a super saver deal. Once I use this, would love to buy again. Recommended 🤟

It is My Review on flipkart. Just thought of adding my review here also!😊 I bought 35ml bottle.Thanks for making small packing of 35ml. It really helps to try the product before buying 200ml bottle which is very costly. Also, I really appreciate that the ingredients used are natural or organic and chemicals used are mostly safe.Most Importantly NO SLS, SLES or PARABENS used👍😊MY REASON for 4 STARS⭐ is written at end!My Review after using it 2 times in last 3 days:Firstly, Though the shampoo is in liquid form, still it doesn't lather much because of being natural and free from lather producing harmful chemicals! It lathers much much less than non-natural shampoos like Dove, Pantene, etc even if you take more quantity of it. So best is take only required quantity as per your hairs and just rub on your hands and apply on the hairs and do not expect much lather.Though it lathers less, but still it is safe and cleans the hair well!It doesn't make my hair SUPER SOFT but provide good amount of Softness and Smoothness to dry hair👍4 STARS⭐ BECAUSE :Though most of the ingredients used are good, but It contains an ingredient called cocamidopropyl Betaine(CAPB). You can call it as a natural ingredient as it is coconut-derived. But PROBLEM is It might IRRITATION on long usage or on short Usage if your skin is sensitive to CAPB. SO, I KINDLY REQUEST JUST HERBS TO USE MORE SAFER ALTERNATIVES.But, STILL It's a MUCH SAFER option than most famous shampoos which contains SLS, SLES or PARABENS.

It helps to remove dirt, sweat and excess sebum from the skin.∙ Sodium Cocoyl Glycinate:It produces a natural creamy-feeling lather. Used for cleansing and skin-softening.∙ Glycerin:Used as a moisturizer to treat or prevent dry, rough, scaly, itchy skin and minor skin irritations.∙ Palmitic Acid:Used for softening or soothing the skin.  It is the most common saturated fatty acid found in animals, plants and microorganism.∙ Niacinamide:A form of vitamin B3. It helps manage acne, rosacea, pigmentation issues, and wrinkles. It also has skin lightening compound.∙ Carrot Seed Oil:Rich in beta carotene, vitamins A and E and pro-vitamin A.It helps to heal dry, chapped and cracked skin, balances the moisture in the skin. It may even help to reduce wrinkles.∙ Tocopheryl Tocopherol Acetate (Vitamin E):Known for its antioxidant properties.∙ Turmeric Powder:Haldi. It contains antioxidants and anti-inflammatory components.∙Liquorice Extract:Yashtimadhu, one of the most commonly used Ayurvedic herbs.It is extracted from Licorice roots. Provides natural sun protection; helps to regulate the skin's oil production and much more.∙ Orange Oil:Reduces dark spots and blemishes, controls excess oil formed on the skin, has antiseptic healing properties, boosts circulation in the skin, and more.∙ Ylang Ylang Oil:Known as the Cananga tree, a tropical tree that is native from India. column1: Please AVOID this if you care for your hair.
column3: Worst shampoo I have ever used. It has lot of problems. I should have earlier understood, why MamaEarth is giving lot of money to YouTubers to promote this shampoo. Let me enumerate the problems it has :-It is highly highly sticky. Even after emptying whole bucket of water while cleaning the hair, stickiness of shampoo doesn't get removed. Hair becomes hard and sticky day by day. And moreover application of oil to hair exacerbate the problem.-It doesn't clean the scalp or hair at all. Dirt still remains there even after rigorous application of shampoo.Also, anything we apply before shampoo like Aloevera, Lemon, Onion juice, etc is not completely removed even after taking too much shampoo and washing with lot of water.-It aggravates the hairfall problem to more worse. It has lead to dandruff poblem in my hair. Every from second day after this shampoo, dandruff start building in the scalp. This doesn't used to happen before.-Hair becomes firzzy, lifeless, sticky, hard, rough after application of this shampoo.-I know it doesn't contain Sodium Lauryl Sulphate, so will not create lot of froth but while using this we have to squeeze a lot of shampoo and still what we see is that hairs are not cleaned. Too much shampoo, too little cleansing. Marketing technique to sell out more shampoo. Pathetic strategy.So my overall suggestion is that please completely avoid this company's product, specifically this shampoo. MamaEarth is using lot of marketing gimmicks to sell their products but the quality of their products is pathetic. Don't fall into the trap of the people on youtube or elsewhere who are going gaga over it and praising a lot. All are paid reviews. Please better avoid this shampoo if you care for hair. But still if you want to take risk, then use this shampoo for one month and you will know the dark side of this shampoo. I generally never give negative reviews a lot but this MamaEarth shampoo deserves to be exposed. This company is thriving just on the basis of marketing. I have seen many people who are facing similar issues. I warn you buy this shampoo at your own risk.

I am neither married nor planning to conceive. However, in the world of pollution & contamination, I try my best to direct nutrition & hygiene towards natural in every possible way. In a motivated abstinence from parabens n chemically- laden products, a casual research on Amazon led me to this amazing company. First, I bought their body butter, then the foot cream as a part of my night ritual. Finally, with the summer in, got their moisturizer.Trust me as I write this, 'their products feel like wrapping yourself in mum's love'. Absolutely pure, amazingly nourishing and adorably pleasant on mind, body n soul. Since, I am well aware of the usage of essential oils, I can bet these products do contain a fine quality of ingredient list. I look forward to transform my personal hygiene n care seulement from this company.P.S- It's a genuine review (for all those market-phobic cynics like me). I am very particular about what I put on my skin. I don't want anything with chemicals in any form. This claims to be all natural, but once you look at the ingredients list, it has several chemical compounds that are hard to pronounce. These compounds are derived from nature and heavily processed and no longer natural. The box claims to only keep out "harmful chemicals". Some of these ingredients can cause irritation to those with sensitive skin, so try a skin test first. I did try it once on my hands to test it. There was a slight burning sensation, but not bad. However, it left my hands very greasy, and my phone screen was covered in oil. It felt as if my hands had a layer of oil on them. I had to wash my hands to stop the burning and to get the oily feel off. The smell is nice and smells natural, which was a positive since it doesn't contain any perfumes/fragrances. Overall, I would have to say "No thanks" to this product. I won't buy it again!

column1: The best body wash - effective, safe and soft on skin
column3: I bought this for my wife and kids (3 year and 1.5 year old). I also tried it on my face. This body is wash is a bit different from other body washes. You need to look at with out any judgement based on the usual body wash you find in Amazon and supermarkets. A good body wash should clean the skin, and not just lather and give a mental feeling. Too much form is no sign of quality. And the body wash should not make skin dry or moisturize it artificially. It should not smell too strong too. It is not expected of a body wash to generate a new smell.And this product thus meets all of my expectations. It does not lather a lot. It need not to applied using a loofah or fiber. It does not have a strong smell. It does not make skin dry. And additionally, the company claims that the body wash is without harmful chemicals like Parabens, Mineral Oil, Sulpathes and even lesser known for Behavioral toxins, Carcinogens, Developmental toxins, Endocrine disruptors, Heavy metals, Neurotoxins, Reproductive toxins or Nanoparticles such as DEA/TEA, Phenoxyethanol, PEGs.ProsCleans well, not hard on skin.ConsIt is costly.  I wish more people would buy it, helping the company to bring down the cost of manufacturing.

This is an overall satisfactory product. The biggest thing I would say though is that it is untoxic and chemical free. That is the only reason I have bought this body wash because I could have gotten many such products far cheaper quantity wise. But this body wash is safe to use. It smells (scent) like Great Gatsby though (Indonesian men's body wash brand). Lathers not too much but adequately. Usually it's the sulphate that makes shampoos and body gels lather so the fact that it doesn't lather much is kind of relieving. Get this if you care about harmful chemicals in your bath products.

This is long overdue. But here it goes!Personally, I was always concerned about my skin during my pregnancy and getting the right kind of skincare is always a bit challenging. There are already a ton of things that you go through when you are pregnant and changes to your body is always one that keeps you concerned. I have always been very careful of the products I use and that’s why finding the most natural and chemical-free products during this phase was quite high up on my list.Sitting in London, there were just way too many choices but I wasn’t sure if they would work. I then stumbled upon The Moms Co. and absolutely loved the products, especially the body butter and the body of the wash. I got ordered these a number of times throughout my pregnancy.Apart from the usual baggage that comes with being pregnant, heartburn is something that kept me awake at nights. The Moms Co.’s tea for pregnancy acidity was really helpful during this phase. Just a little bit and it eased the acidity.I would highly recommend these products. I continue to use them post delivery and love the feel of it on my skin.

column1: Great Product. Perfect for Moms. Suitable for Moms to be!
column3: I use this shower gel twice daily with a loofah. It is hands down a great product!Pros -1. Unlike other body washes, this one does not lather. It is a myth that if your soap or wash lathers only then you get clean. In fact, lack of lather shows how natural the product is. Thumbs up for this!2. No harmful chemicals + Australian Certified + Made Safe Product + Dermatologically tested. This means it is super safe to be used by Moms and Moms to be.3. Leaves the skin very supple because of the goodness of the essential oils used.4. The beautiful aroma of the wash keeps lingering for a good time.5. Overall does what it claimsCons - Priced slightly on the higher side. (This may be an issue to some, but for all the pros, this con can be easily ignored)Thanks The Moms Co. for such a beautiful product. As a mother, I really feel relaxed and refreshed after using this shower gel. Looking forward to use other products from your brand.

It is a fresh subtle scent. I have been using it since I was 14 weeks pregnant and it has lasted me a very long time. I am now 26 weeks and I still have some left. I am happy with my purchase.

I had been seeing overwhelmingly positive reviews for this brand. The shampoo didn’t work very well (made my hair super sticky) but I thought I’d check out other products to make an informed evaluation of the products. I wanted to support ethical startups using natural products so went for another try.Boy, do I regret it. The face wash is extremely drying. I thought it was the initial phase of using different products, but the skin from my nose continued to peel even after 3 weeks of using the product. I followed it up with the Moms Co. face serum and used moisturiser too.My face broke out like never before. I had started to control my acne after many years with rigorous diet changes and multiple consultations and now it looks worse than before.The worst part of the experience however was the customer service. I followed up with them because I still believe small startups using natural produce should be supported and I honestly wanted advice on what to do for my skin and hair (I still want to go natural). While the customer relations personnel was sweet, I had to follow up many times and eventually returned disappointed because she had zero tips for me, leave alone reimbursement or alternative product suggestion.In conclusion: Don’t waste money on this stuff. DIY is your best friend- from ubtan to shea/ olive oil and essential oils, all of this is safer than this face wash.

I am generally too lazy to write product reviews but this time I had to. I have curly hair and the right shampoo was a distant dream. Shampoos made my hair dry and frizzy, even the ones for curly hair. But not  this product from mama and Co. Very gentle on my hair and doesn't strip it of much needed moisture. Cleanses and soothes my hair very well. In love with curls again! Need to lather well first with both hands and then apply for best results.

They say that we should use it continuously then only can see the result since it is a natural product. But my hair is becoming frizzier and there was heavy hairfall while shampooing. It has a smell of old surf excel detergent. I tried up to a quarter of a bottle. The hairfall seemed  reduced after continuous washing for 5 days daily. but returned when switched to 2 washes in a week . So I'm confused. Doesn't have courage to try more. So stopped using. Since there are different types of reviews and every hair type is different, you can also try it. Its texture is different than other shampoos, feel like watery.

column1: Now it is the worst shampoo, earlier it was really good
column3: Since last 4-5 months, this shampoo is causing severe hair fall and thinning. I have been using it since last 2 years, and it was magic to the hair, made it strong, thick, shinning and added volume. But I think a few month back, they have added foaming chemicals like SLS, Sulphate etc. because customers were earlier complaining about very less foam and they had to use very large quantity for a wash. But guys, don't you understand that for more foam, they have to use SLS. So I think the company has added loads of SLS in this shampoo or some very harmful chemicals for too much foam in recent months, because now I can see lots of foam even with a small quantity of shampoo. And that is causing severe harm to the hair and hair fall and thinning. I want Amazon to pass on this strong negative feedback to the company Mom's Co and ask them to stop using any SLS or any harmful chemicals for foaming and bring this shampoo back to earlier it was originally. And I want Amazon to refund my money which I spent to buy this shampoo last time. I'm also going to post the same bad review for this shampoo in Mom's Co website directly.

Shoutout to Mom's for taking initiative on natural products. I saw no noticable changes in my hair, but that is a personal thing. Understand that hair is different for everyone, so choose your product wisely

column1: Seems to be improving the quality of my dry hair. I feel good about my hair already!
column3: Right from product packaging, to the quality and the post application look and feel delivered by this shampoo, my experience is - it's absolutely clean, natural, and healthy.I have been using it for about 2 weeks now, and I am not going back to either of the giants we all have been trumped by, for all these years. I do feel, combining it with a bi-weekly application of a conditioner will give that extra boost to the hair's nourishment and management.My hair's length is about 5-6 inches, and it easily cleanses my scalp off the oil I apply the previous night, leaving no residue.All in all, it's worth the price, and seems to be staying true to the brand's tagline "nature in, toxins out".

The liquid is thin compared to other commercially available shampoos so would need to use a bit more than usual but it leaves the hair clean and has reduced my hairfall to an extent too. Much better for your hair,pocket and for the environment. Yes it does consumes a bit of your time but it's worth it.

Shampoo on amazon.Its a natural protein rich sampoo devoid of any toxins like parabens , sulphates n more so i thot to give it a try and after the first wash i could feel my hair getting softer and shinnier however its too early to comment abt its hair strengthening claim right now..But over all its a good shampoo and would like to give a try to other moms co products too.

Sometimes I feel it hasn't cleaned well as it's very mild and doesn't lather, so after every 4-5 washes I use a regular shampoo like about once every 15-20 days. Causes hair to be dry, tangled and weak. During the wash I lose about 30 strands and then while towel drying my hair I lose a little more. Even when it's fully dry, a comb won't pass through without causing pain. A lot of quantity is required and impossible to reach the inside of your hair after first wash cause it causes a weird texture to the hair. A conditioner/serum is a must if you wish to touch your hair after wash. Really not happy. Only good thing is it does not foam much and has no chemical smell.Never buying it again.

column1: Dubious product - Another synthetic Body Wash laced with chemicals
column3: This product does not deserve more than a single star rating here. For one, it was delivered in a flimsy packaging with just some scotch tape wound around its nozzle. It could have been easily tampered with for all you know. I am really dubious about its authenticity. It is quite possible that some cheap shampoo is inside the bottle. Anyway, I thought of using the product since I had paid a premium price to acquire an organic and sustainable shower gel. It smells of nothing, which is good because it claims to be made of natural derivatives, but it gives away the natural tag as you mix it up with water. The body wash foams up like crazy. Lots of lather, which is a clear indicator that it is not made up of any natural derivatives, instead just another cheap shower gel. Buy at your own risk.

column1: A Good Hair Cream for Men
column3: Arata Men Hair Cream is high on price but when you start using it you come to know why its distinct from others.This is my Second time purchase of product as in between i tried other hair cream too but now have decided to use this cream.Its chemical free and easy for use for daily use on your hair.4/5 ⭐

I have been using this product for almost 2 years now and i am a big fan of arata . I have tried almost all the famous creams that are in the market for curly hair but none of them has the hold that arata cream provides . I have always switched back to this cream . This has worked wonders for me ❤️

I wouldnot say its best in market but better than most. However it completely depends on your skin type hence unless you personally use it, its no use reading reviews. I have dry scalp and this starts itching after maybe 4 5 hours later. Easy to use easy to wash no complains there good scent. However considering its natural i was hoping to go through the day without scratching my head. I use it only on ocassions and its easy to live with it for a day but i doubt it will be good for everyday use i wont take chances there. My advice try and see yourself.

column1: Act more like a gel/wax than a cream
column3: I thought using a natural cream would help my hair but it makes the hair texture rough and dry moments after applying. I have used some hair creams with less price which gives natural soft texture to the hair.

Though it says that it gives a little hold, but it gives a really good hold for more than 6hrs. I have very thin hair, so without a Hairgel or cream my hair easily looses whatever hold I give. But this Arata hair cream gives a very good hold. After a little use of hair dryer, I used it. And best part is that unlike HairGels, it doesn't gives too much of rugged, tight hair texture. Rather it gives a very good natura hair texture. You wont see your hair as  solid, unmovable, too stationary look as happens in hair gels. Even if ur hair looses the hold, just simple put ur fingers over your hairs, it will gain shape . So ultimately for a natural, all organic Hair cream,, who doesn't want too rugged look of Hairgel lookjl, just go for it.

column1: Must try hair cream for curlies!
column3: I have 3a/3b curls, that are really dry and frizzy. I've used arata hair cream for a week now (and have used it 5 times to style and refresh my curls) and here is what I noticed:-it has good hold .-slip is not that great which doesn't make it suitable for finger coiling hair.-it leaves a cast on, so sotc is important.-tames frizz considerably.-has a very mild fragrance.Although, the packaging could be better as it's only sealed with a tape that can be easily tampered with.Update(personal experience based on using it for three months):How/when it works best:-When used on wet hair (hair should make squishy sound when scrunched).-When emulsified (preferably with a little water and/or lightweight oil).-When used in sections of hair(raked or brushed).

column1: It will be good if they do something about product smell and after side effect
column3: For menPros.* For damp hair medium to good hold it will give irrespective of hair length (lasts 3 to 5 hr). And the hair is mangeable once u put ur hand in hair the hold starts to fade* For dry hair its give light hold, and best suited for short hairCons.* Very pungent smell like traditional men local salon* U will definitely feel headache after 2 hr of application , first i thought i have headache due to late night sleep but then i found out when i used this product i get headache.* Product gets oxidized and show red colour at the edges. Don't know this good for hair or not but when u wash u will see some hair in ur hand.Ps. My hair is thin and straight

column1: Love the curl cream ..and this ccomes from a curl gel lover
column3: I have long and curly hair..and i always love a gel to scrunch the hair.But oh my god ..i love this product.It doesnt give a hard hold like a gel...but you get beautiful defined,loose and soft curls.its not easy to apply and cannot scrunch with it at first.....This works best on soaking wet hair and not towel dried hair from my experience...our hair needs to be really wet for the product to work else it will be clump  up on hairWet your palms .Take little and rub between your palm well to make the cream flully and then  rake the product in ..take little quantity and rake small sections each ..i do this by flipping my hair front ..finally when the product is all coated well, i scrunch my hair ..and then tie my hair loose with cotton tshirt as we all normally do for 10 mins..then air dry...once 90% dry i scrunch again..this works best for winter and drier months ...not yet tested in humid climate yet...if you want extra hold,apply a curl gel after applying the cream when it still wet and then scrunch and tie with t shirt

column1: OK. Must have an inner seal.

column1: Waste of money . Ruins curls . Causes extreme dryness
column3: Difficult to use. No hold.  Causes dryness. Causes frizz.If I could have given this zero stars i would have.I have dry ,high porosity curly hair. I used this because a number of curly hair bloggers recommended it . It did not work for me at all.Application is difficult as the cream is not a smooth blend , and a lot of it clings more to your hand.  On application on Hair , it leaves a white layer behind like , like you've applied collage toothpaste . The finished look creates an oily look, has no curl clumps but rather creates hard wiry curls .On damp hair, used after rinse off conditioner,  the application when mixed with water is easier, but it still leaves behind clumps of white residue. Once again you only get hard wire like curls that are very stiff , almost like a gel. Day 2 curls have no hold , hair has an oily look , it gets very frizzy and dry , curls all open out .On soaking wet hair : applied after leave in conditioner,  still get a white residue. Curls are hard wired gel like appearance. Curls open up easily, any hold I have came from the gel I layered .  Causes extreme frizz, no curl definition at all on day 2

The overpowering musky, cheap -90s-middle-aged-macho fragrance was dreadful and did not go away. Even brylcream smells better.Used it after leave-in. My hair has always been slightly wavy & very frizz prone. I've never known what to do with it, so I always straightened or curled it with hot tools to make it look good.Then a few months ago I got to know of the curly girl method and natural ways to style your hair. So I gave it a try & never looked back!This is easy to use, has good clean ingredients & still gives me excellent hold. I have extremely porous hair & live in Mumbai where humidity is hitting 90% almost daily & still I'm protected from frizz all day. It does dry very crunchy but I SOTY (scrunch the crunch out) with a lightweight oil or serum.This fades away by the second day but there's no crunchiness or residue like some hair spray. This is the only gel I've tried but I'm going to keep buying this (I'm already on my second tube & have bought the third as a backup). Would recommend it to all wavy / curly girls looking for a product to help form & hold your waves / curls - I also have a video on my youtube channel explaining & demonstrating how to use this.
Applied over a small dab of conditioner after washing and the gel gives a shiny hold that defines the curls and lasts half a day. Minimises frizz as long as you don't touch your hair.

The hold it gives is just ok, fine for shaping your hair. Hold also lasts pretty long. If you're buying this product to get the same hold as the other gels or wax provide, which are full of harmful chemicals then you should avoid this. It's not for you.As also don't fall in Arata's marketing strategy that you can use it daily. Plz don't do that. It's gel after all, just it contains natural ingredients. It will surely harm your hair in the long run (im talking about boys, not sure about curly hair girls). Boys can use it twice or thrice a week. ✌️

And when paired with the cream, it has given me some of the best hair days! And mind you, I am very finicky about my hair and I have hereditary premature greying, because of which I am EXTREMELY cautious of what I use on my hair, and this brand only has the good stuff! It leaves absolutely no fragrance in the hair (a plus for me) and does not dry out your hair like the other so called “organic” products. Also love that it’s not tested on animals. column1: Don't buy this if you are looking for strong hold

column1: Photosensitive ingredients like lemon and orange
column3: I am concerned to see the ingredients list, besides what all negative experiences people are posting. The brand may have tried their best, but using citruses like lemon and orange in whatever form will damage your hair melanin. If someone applies this product and goes out in the Sun, it will go through photochemical reaction with sunlight and may fade the person's natural hair color. Regular use and sun exposure might cause graying.
Don’t buy waste of money....

column1: Ingredients are CG friendly but the result is not.
column3: I bought this from the arata website after reading reviews from a lot of CG  bloggers including CuriousJalebiI agree this is a nice lightweight gel and maybe good for men or women who want a slickwet look but it has ZERO hold.It was impossible to create a gel cast. Diffusing caused the gel cast to break prematurely and caused over moisturized type frizzing.After rebalancing...second time around and using almost half the tube I managed to get a gel cast which caused major MAJOR moisture overload.Fyi: I have fine strand, type 2b/2c low to medium porosity frizzy hair with a sensitive scalp.I would not recommend this to any CG who is less than a type 3c who needs a good hold and a good gel cast.Yes the ingredients are "natural" and I don't like fragrance in my products so theoretically this relatively fragrance free gel should have made me happy. But frankly it was a waste of money and homemade flax seed gel would have been a better use of time.

Best one I’ve used so far and I’m not a gel person at all!! Needed something to fight the frizz though. Not a hard hold gel on me but definitely helps curls hold shape whilst keeping them soft and shiny!! It’s day two: Scalp feels clean and hair looks good!! Couldn’t ask for more except if it could be easier still on the pocket

column1: Clear your bathroom shelves for this hero
column3: Years of lifeless, dull, dandruff and basically sad hair gone during this lockdown. Arata shampoo and conditioner was just lying around my bathroom and I had just given up on everything assuming these too won’t work for me. Boy was I wrong. I admit that these shampoo and conditioner were preceded by religious oil therapy ( thanks hubby) but these shampoo conditioner just calmy removed excess oil and relaxed my unbearable itching scalp. In a month, i have shiny hair, calm scalp and 1.5 inches of hair growth. It’s a wonderful product and I ll keep buying it.Psst: the smell of it like those mini bottle shampoo u get in a five star hotel. It’s that amazing. Kudos to the duo 😁

I’ve been using curly hair products for the past 4 years now. Loved being on the “no damage” journey. Arata is one of the first few curly hair products in the Indian market and the prices were quite reasonable, so I thought I’d give it a shot. The Arata gel is good, I liked the hard cast which needs to be scrunched till hair gets soft, their cream smelt like strong chemicals so I did not purchase their latest green label hair cream. After using the shampoo and conditioner my hair feels ripped, damaged and frizzy. Shampoo smells like toothpaste. Used the products for two washes- won’t be using them again. Hope I’ll be able to reverse my hair damage. It is not curly hair friendly. Unlike their disclaimer on the product which says “NO TOXIC STUFF. WE MEAN IT!” Please read the ingredients before purchase these experimental products.

column1: dont fall for this. only sensitive scalp needs sls free
column3: this company was recommended to me by my friend. she has curly hair. i have pin straight hair. this shampoo did work for her. idk if it reduced my hairfall. at first i was having loads because i continued using hard water. that is very harmful for hair. when i discontinued using hard water this shampoo worked more efficiently. although, before i discontinued using hard water, it did help my hair against it. it is a an okay shampoo cos it requires alot to clean your scalp otherwise your hair feels greasy and oily. this was my first time trying a non sulphate shampoo. what appealed to me was that, this shampoo has such powerful ingredients so i wanted to give this a shot. for my mother, it didnt work. it dried out her hair. she has severe hairfall and this shampoo didnt work for her. I think it may not work for everyone. this is an okay shampoo, i have almost used the whole bottle now cos i couldnt throw my money away and i wash my hair once a week. it doesnt leave my hair dry and  but it doesnt lather and it says this on the bottle also so i have to drench my hair alot and double cleanse sometimes to make it lather. i have always used sulphate shampoos and they lather well so i miss that. i have also noticed that on amazon there are fake reviews. i am very upset with this.

column1: I am a fan of this scrub
column3: This has been the best face scrub i have ever tried. This does not cause breakouts or any after effects like other scrubs, especially walnut scrubs when used on oily to normal skin. The best part is, you can also use it as a face wash. It says it is SLS and parabens free, but i myself could never detect the difference between products who have SLS and who don’t. But this definitely does not have any side effects even when used regularly for long time so i think it is SLS and parabens free for real. I used to have an oily skin but regular use of this scrub along with Richfeel calendula soap as an alternative to face wash, has made my skin so smooth and acne free. After washing my face with this scrub, i tone my skin using Biotique cucumber toner and then moisturise and massage my skin with Johnsons Baby Cream. This is my every night routine which is a really good alternative to expensive Korean skin regime products. One bottle goes a long way. You can see the difference in first wash itself. It makes the skin look fresh, removes dirt and oiliness, and leaves a healthy looking face. It has a really good fragrance. I love how my face and cheeks glow after using it. My friends tried this after listening to my reviews and they also fell in love with this product. This is my second bottle. The first one lasted for entire year.

column1: A shampoo that is very close to a natural shampoo

Have used it for a month, it produces a sufficient amount of lather with small quantities (applicable to men). The bottle may last for close to a month depending on our daily consumption. Having actually used an Aloe vera on my hair rather than the Aloe vera based shampoo that this claims to be. After applying my shampoo, dandruff has reduced, hair has become shinier than before. However, hair fall hasn't dropped or stopped. Expecting the hair fall to stop after next month. For the price point, I expected the shampoo bottle to be a little bigger. I recommend this product to others to use.

I have thin hairs, dry scalp and dandruff as well (medium, not heavy dandruff).After going through all the variety of products KHADI NATURAL SHAMPOO has & also after reading reviews for all the products, I felt that this particular type will be best for my requirements. Used it for 2 months.It was helpful with dandruff but only for 1-2 days from the wash. Dandruff came back easily & very soon. So it wasn't much of a relief. So people with heavy dandruff should think before buying it. My scalp did feel cleansed but not properly & deeply as the product promises. The product does moisturize the scalp well. Since I have a dry scalp, it was a good thing for me. Didn't help much with hair fall even though I used it with KHADI NATURAL CONDITIONER (SLS & PARABEN FREE). Though the shiny texture of the shampoo made me wonder whether it is 100% SLS & PARABEN FREE or not.Have to use a lot of quantity. 1 bottle lasts for 2 months for a single user (medium hair length).Product was delivered on time. The packaging was good. Received original product.

column1: Use with care, and it may work
column3: I'm writing this review after throwing away 40% of the cream, as it changed colour and smelled rancid within a little over 1 month.It did work a little for my skin in terms of glow and a bit of glass skin effect, but after breaking out my skin badly to begin with ( and I never had pimples even as a teenager). But again, I heard natural it-It creams can make you breakout. So, it used it persistently.So, use with a lot of caution and care as it has a very short shelf life, but I'm not complaining, as I value a natural product over a chemical laden one.The company could really offer it in pump bottle, as touching the product with hand repeatedly and exposure to air is causing it to go bad. It is also runny and really greasy, so it can last for 2 months actually and a pump bottle can be really handy.However, I'm gonna buy it again to try it during winter, as I'm simply in love with the same range's Vit C face wash and toner (toner oxidizes too, but thankfully comes in a flip-top bottle). In short, the product can work for your skin if these issues are taken care of.

column1: Harmful chemicals free shampoo, suitable for dry hair

This also contain hydrolyzed Keratain which helps to get smooth and silky hair. Its sulfate and paraben free. This is a perfect solution for dry, frizzy and unmanageable hairs.
